loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los cultivos de Rufina, son de los mejores cuidados de su poblado, sus plátanos y café son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de abonar muy bien sus chacras. En el mercado de La Merced, es el lugar donde tiene más demanda de sus productos, además que son adquiridos a un precio más cómodo.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados al recolectar gran parte de lo sembrado, por ello procura cuidarlo con abono y protegerlos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar su producción, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras para que estén bien fertilizadas.
texts.en:
Rufina is 32 years old. She is an unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her 3 beloved children, to whom she wishes to provide a better future. Rufina's cultivations are the best cared-for fields in the village. Her bananas and coffee are of excellent quality especially because she has always been able to provide enough fertilizer to her fields. In the La Merced markets is where her products are in highest demand and where they are sold at the best prices. What she likes best about her work is fertilizing the fields and protecting them against insect pests. In time she hopes to improve her harvests and to improve her earnings. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been very punctual with her payments, especially because she feels a great responsibility towards the institution. In her community group she is a very dedicated member always looking for the development of the group at large. With the two thousand nuevos soles she requests he will purchase more fertilizers for her fields, so that they always remain well supplied.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single woman living with her parents. She lives in Lebanon. Despite her young age, she has been working for several years as a beautician. Her business is based from her home and she also works as traveler beautician. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in more materials for her work; she will purchase a laser and a wax machine. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in more materials for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR THE CREATION OF HER ARTISAN WORKS

loans.name: Eddy Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Eddy Donato; el tiene 51 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de ferretería donde vende todo tipo de herramientas, el socio atiende desde las 7:30 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de ferretería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería al por mayor.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eddy is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name.

Mr. Eddy Donato is 51 years old. He is married and he has 2 children. He has a hardware store from where he sells all types of tools. He has his business open for business from 7:30 a.m. to 7:00 pm. It is through this business that he is able to provide for his children. He would like to expand his hardware store. He requests a loan to purchase more inventories in wholesale.

He is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools in wholesale.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es casada con Jose  tienen sus hijos pequeños están en edad escolar , paulina trabaja todos los días vendiendo en su local cosas del consumo diario , tiene que aprovechar en si las festividades para vender al doble , a parte de eso en su casa tiene una crianza de pollos y cerdos los cuida mucho ya que en  estos tiempos los tiene que ir engordando y asi le pagan bien se acerca la feria de san martin jilotepeque, paulina cuenta con el apollo de jose ya que tiene una peluquería y también trabaja todos los días .
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos de granos basicos y compra de cerdos pequeños,agradese a FAPE  por la ayuda brindada , paulina sueña con tener un local propio para ya no alquilar y asi ahorrar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Paulina is married to Jose and together they have young children who are of school age.  She works every day selling daily consumer products from her store.  Paulina plans to take advantage of the holidays in order to double her sales.  In addition to managing her store, she raises chickens and pigs at home and looks after them with great care.  Lately she has spent time fattening them so that she can get paid well when it comes time to sell them at the fair in San Martin Jiltepeque.  Paulina has the support of her husband Jose, who operates a barber shop and also works every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains and piglets.  Paulina is grateful for the support FAPE has provided.  She dreams of owning a store so that she no longer has to rent and hopes to save a little more.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains & piglets

loans.name: Mariana Hermelida

texts.es:
Mariana Hermelida C. G. tiene 38 años, es soltera, vive  con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo de 19 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Mariana  trabaja en la bananera como Desfloradora  de banano y en aplicación de fertilizantes en la hacienda, trabaja desde hace dos año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Mariana Hermelida Chavez Garcia is 38 years old. She is single and lives with her son in the Ventanas subdivision in the Los Rios province. Her son is 19 years old. 

The members of the V.R.C. Dole 2 dedicate themselves to agricultural labors at the Dole banana plantation. All the members live in the Ventanas subdivision and the majority of them have been working for more than a year at the plantation. Their work is related to the banana plantation. There are approximately 13 members in the group. 

Mariana works at the banana plantation deflorating the banana and applying fertilizers. She has worked there for two years. She makes her purchases at the commissary in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan to establish a business in her home, to make renovations to the premises and to purchase products for her business. The support from this loan will help her economically to support her needs. Her dream is to improve her home and to meet the goal of establishing her business. 

She enjoys cooking.

loans.use: To establish her business in her home and to renovate the premises.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Tito; el tiene 38 años de edad y es casado; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y mantenimiento de su carro.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tito, 38, is a member of the “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” (Always United) communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is married.  He alternates his daily chores with the transportation business.  He has a car with which he provides taxi service.  He works from 6am until 6pm.  He wants to improve his taxi service and is asking for a loan to buy replacement parts and to service his car.

He thanks those who share in his dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Gardenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PRIMAVERA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gardenia; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de productos agroindustriales, la socia vende chocolates y cafes, ella es propietaria de una planta que distribuye estos productos en la ciudad de Quillabamba, ella quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chocolates y cafes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para producir el chocalate y café.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “PRIMAVERA”. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, belonging to the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is Gardenia. She is 26 years old and single. She alternates her activities between her daily activities and the business of agro-industrial products.  She sells chocolates and coffee and is the owner of a plant that distributes these products in the city of Quillabamba. She wants to expand the business of selling chocolates and coffee. She is asking for the loan to buy materials to produce the chocolate and the coffee.  

The member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy materials to produce chocolate and coffee.

loans.name: Ana Empeatriz

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que con esfuerzo tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa de caña. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín ha trabajado para ayudar a su esposa a mantener a sus cinco hijos de 13, 10, 5, 4, 3 años de edad. Empezó hace tres años atrás con víveres de primera necesidad variados. En la actualidad trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm con la ayuda de su hermana también trabaja los fines de semana. Vende en la tienda arroz, azúcar, confites, enlatados etc. La incomodidad que tiene para trabajar con eficiencia es comprar los víveres ya que el sitio está muy lejos y tiene que alquilar un carro para que la acompañe. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceite, enlatados para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y comprar una camioneta para hacer las comprar de la tienda.
texts.en:
35 year old Ana is a hard-working woman who with great effort has a small store in the front part of her house built of reeds.

She lives in a suburban area called Fortín and works helping her husband support their five children ages 13, 10, 5, 4, and 3. She began her business three years ago selling basic needs items. Today she works in the store from 6:00 AM until 10:00 PM with the help of her sister she also works on the weekends. In the store she sells rice, sugar, candy, canned goods, etc.  The inconvenience she has working efficiently is having to buy the goods as the locale is very far and she has to rent a car to take her.

She wishes to continue with her business and therefore with the loan she wants to buy rice, oil and canned goods in order to provide a better life for her children. In the future she wants to build a house out of cement and buy a small truck to make purchases for her store.

loans.use: Rice, oil, canned goods

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal Las Cumplidas, vive por la parroquia de San Joaquín siendo este sector el mayor productor de hortalizas ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La Señora. María tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo esta en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una camioneta que es de su propiedad y realiza fletes, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María labora hace 10 años en una asociación de venta de verduras, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de verduras, trabaja desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de domingo a domingo.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 8 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando más verduras. Su sueño es  no tener deudas.
texts.en:
María S. is a member of the Las Cumplidas communal bank. She lives in the parish of San Joaquín, which is a major producer of vegetables with a population that farms and raises animals.
María is 38 years old, married and has 2 children aged 15 and 11. Her eldest daughter attends secondary school and her younger son attends one of the schools in the city. Her husband works as a driver, operating his own small truck, and provides a transportation service. With both of them working, they have been able to build their own house.
María has worked for 10 years with an association that sells vegetables. She runs a business buying and selling vegetables, working from 3 in the morning until 6 in the evening Sunday to Sunday.
She has been with this communal bank for 8 years and she will invest her new loan in her business, buying more vegetables. Her dream is to be debt-free.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Dora Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Dora Pérez es soltera, labora en UNICA como secretaria, solicita este crédito para pagos de estudios
texts.en: Mrs. Dora P. is single and she works as a secretary in Unica. She requests a loan to pay for her school tuition.

loans.use: To cover school tuition.

loans.name: Yolanda Esteher

texts.es:
La Sra. Yolanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Proceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín . Es Casada, tiene 62 años y es madre de 01hijo.
Yolanda , es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, que ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y  motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Oriflame, y ya lleva varios años ejerciendo este negocio, obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde ofrece y recibe a sus clientes. También sale a ofrecer sus productos a sus amistades, en lo que al mes tiene varios pedidos, que lo hacen mediante el catalogo de su línea. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa de alcanzar poco a poco sus metas.
 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  mas productos de belleza, para tenerlos en stock como: colonias, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes y cremas para damas y caballeros, lápiz labiales y para contornos de ojos , polvos compactos,  y otros productos  mas, todo esto para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Yolanda, se siente muy contenta de su negocio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo a mujeres que quieren trabajar y salir adelante,  espera que sigan así siempre y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the "Los Proceres" community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province, in San Martín department.  She is 62 years old, married, and has one child.

Yolanda is a hard-working and enterprising woman who, faced with the need to make her own income and through her own self motivation, set up her small business selling Oriflame-brand cosmetics.  She has been in her business for several years and it has done very well since the beginning.  Her business is located in a part of her home which is very well adapted for the purpose and here she greets her customers and sells them her products.  She also goes out to sell her products to her friends and every month she has several orders that they make through her catalog.  She is continuing in the same business and she is very proud to be gradually achieving her goals.

With this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles, Yolanda will buy more beauty products to have in stock such as aftershave, perfume, talcum powder, deodorants, ladies' and men's creams, lip sticks, eye liners, powder compacts and other products that will keep her customers happy.  

Yolanda feels very happy with her business and she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support they provide to women who want to work and get ahead in life.  She hopes that they will keep doing this and that they help many families and enterprising women.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Grace Achieng

texts.en:
Grace N. is a single mother of four children who are all in school. They live in Migori town.

Grace has a business selling second-hand clothes and curtains. She has been doing this business for the past 12 years and has seen her business grow through the years. 

Grace is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD., which will enable her to buy more clothes and curtains to add to her stock. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and curtains to add to her stock

loans.name: Mariette

texts.en:
Mariette is 36 years old and lives with her husband and child who is in education. Mother and father work to take care of their child. She has just moved to a new area in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital.

Along with her change of location, she is hoping to change activities by selling wood and charcoal. She has previously had four loans through ALIDE, all repaid with no problems. With the loan she will purchase bulk charcoal and wood for resale at her stall. She hopes to become established in her new venture.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta S. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Marrieta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marrieta owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts & green bananas in the local community. Marrieta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marrieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marrieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marrieta is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copra & green bananas. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Marrieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts for copra & green bananas.

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es: María vive en el distrito de Yonan ubicado en la provincia de Contumaza en el norte de Perú. Tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 14 años de edad. Vive junto a su familia en la zona rural de su distrito. Gana la vida criando y vendiendo chanchos y aves de corral como pavos, patos y gallina. Ella cria los animales en un pequeño terreno cerca de su casa. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende en el mercado local. Además, genera ingresos adicionales trabajando como jornalera en las chacras en su zona. Desea ampliar su negocio y invertir su préstamo en la compra de más animales para engorde y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles. Esta inversión la ayudará aumentar sus ingresos. María es muy trabajadora y responsable. Ha manejado otro préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa y lo canceló de manera puntual. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio para poder mejorar su domicilio y ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María lives in the Yonan district, located within the Contumaza province in northern Peru.  She is 35 years old, single, and has two children, ages 13 and 14.  She lives with her family in the rural part of the district.  María earns her living selling hogs and corral birds, like turkeys, ducks, and chickens, which she raises on a small plot of land near her home.  When they have reached a good size and weight, she sells them at the local market.  She also earns additional income working on other farms in her zone.

She would like to expand her business by buying balanced feed and more animals to fatten up, so she has seen fit to request a 1,200 PEN loan.  This investment will help increase her income.  She is very responsible and hard working.  She has had a previous loan through Edpyme Alternativa and repaid it on schedule.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing her business to be able to improve her home and offer a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Ti

texts.en: Ti T., 41, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. T. raises pigs to sell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband grows yams to sell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 40 on food and USD 35 on other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase pigs to raise and to build a place to grow mushrooms. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to build a place to grow mushrooms.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen C. is a married woman with one school-aged child. She is now 33 years old. Karen sells food like sweetened candies to the people in her community. She has been in this business for more than three years and she earns approximately PHP 4,000 per month.

Karen is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make more candies to sell.

In the future, Karen hopes to improve the business she manages in order to earn more income to support the education of their child. She is thankful that Kiva lenders are always there to improve her small business, and she hopes that through patience and hard work, she will become successful in her business someday.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make more candies to sell

location.town: Balzain, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and batteries for his business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old and married. She has 2 children. Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que trabaja en la venta diaria posee una pequeño almacén donde ofrece una pequeña variedad a todos sus clientes.
Ella trabaja en este rubro hace más de 3 años. Tiene 3 hijos y esta casada hace ya 13 años, ella tuvo conocimiento del programa de comité de Mujeres y al conocer acerca de lo que ofrece, quedó encantada con la idea de formar un grupo de señoras que tengan una misma visión de progreso personal y familiar, desea salir adelante con ellas para que todas crezcan de la misma manera para que asi sus familias tengan una vida digna y decorosa.
El grupo esta formado con 16 señoras que actualmente estan en el 9no ciclo, estas señoras son muy responsables y tienen mucha voluntad de salir adelante gracias a la ayuda que les podria brindar la Fundación Paraguaya.
Solicitan el credito para la ampliacion de la despensa, para poder aumentar la variedad que va a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works daily in her small store where she can offer a limited variety of goods to her customers.

She has worked in this manner for some 3 years. Maria Luisa has 3 children and has been married nearly 13 years. She learned about the program of “Mujeres” and about what it offers. She was enchanted with the idea of forming a group of women who, having similar vision of personal and family progress, desired to get ahead together, so that everyone could grow in the same manner and their families might lead a dignified and decorous life.

The group is composed of 16 women who are presently in their 9th loan cycle. These women are very responsible and show great drive to advance, thanks to the help the Fundacion Paraguaya can offer.

They are requesting a loan to expand their stock of food, so they can increase the variety of merchandise they offer their customers.

loans.use: buy groceries and other products to resupply the stock of food she offers her customers.

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.en:
Salimjon lives and works in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married and the father of three children. He works as a farmer. Before, he worked as a firefighter and today he is a pensioner. Pension fees which he receives are not enough to provide for his family and children’s needs. That’s why currently Salimjon engages in cultivating of potatoes, onions, wheat and carrots and also raises cattle. Salimjon would like to get a loan of 12000 TJS for purchasing mineral fertilizers and cattle. The profit which he makes from this business allows him to take care of his family. Salimjon hopes that lenders will support him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Abie. She is a widow and has 2 children, ages 26 and 23 years. 

In 2007, Abie established her used electronic items and drinks business. She began her business because she has to enhance her independence. This business is her major source of income. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Abie requires a loan in order to buy DVD players, amplifiers and drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Abie plans to establish a modern electronic and drinks shop, to own a house, and to also embark in international business. The current high rate of inflation is her business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy DVD players, amplifiers, and drinks for her business

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 29 years old and married with three children aged between two and 10 years old. She also takes care of five relatives. She sells charcoal and has six years experience in this business. She works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except Saturday.

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits, she will invest in her business, pay school fees for her children, save for her future, and be able to buy a motorcycle to help her in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and is married with 3 children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Helen has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income buying and selling rice.

Helen aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Tujikaze Plus Group

texts.en: Lucie, age 49, sells clothing. With her next loan, she is planning to purchase a roll of fabric to make school uniforms to sell with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $400 per month. Lucie’s ambition is to someday open a drugstore in her area. She is married and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 11 and 27 years old. All of them attend school. She is also taking care of her two nieces. Lucie’s business is in the eastern part of Lubumbashi. Lubumbashi is a city located in the south-east of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Lubumbashi is the second largest city in the DRC which was not spared of the crisis and multiple wars that hit the DRC during the '90s. It is from 2000 until today that the informal sector took off. Lucie has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2003. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC having four times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Lucie is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named Tujikaze Plus in Lubumbashi. It is composed of 11 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a roll of fabric to make school uniforms for selling

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Melina has a shop that sells snacks, fish paste, milk & chocolate powdered drinks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Melina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta D. lácteos, este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años, desD. entonces se ha encargado D. ofrecer lo mejor en quesos, cuajada y todos los derivados D. la leche, este negocio le ha ayudado para solventar necesidades en su hogar.
Actualmente necesita comprar quesos, crema, leche, queso fresco y requesón, para surtir el negocio, pues ella los compra ya elaborados, esta inversión será D. mucha ayuda para Patricia.
El objetivo D. ella es recibir el apoyo D. financiamientos, para poderse desarrollar en el negocio, tratando siempre D. mantener un buen record.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her husband and 10-year-old daughter.  She sells dairy products.  She started this business 15 years ago.  Since then she’s strengthened it offering the best in cheese, curd and all other milk derivatives.  This business has helped her meet her household needs.

She currently needs to buy cheese, cream, milk, fresh cheese and cottage cheese to stock the business because she buys them already make.  This investment will be of much help for Patricia.

Her goal is to receive financial support to develop in business always striving to maintain a good record.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, milk, fresh cheese and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is works hard to improve his family's living situation. He is 36 years old, married and thankful because the couple have been blessed with two children, now school-aged. To make a living, he is engaged in a retail store, operating for three years and based in their home. He earns about 300 (Philippine peso) daily.

He is aiming to increase his profits due to expensive basic commodities and high electric bills. So, for this reason, he is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P20,000 to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles and biscuits for his grocery store. He believes that he can improve his store through the loan amount he has requested.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, instant noodles and biscuits to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: Muema

texts.en:
Muema is a married man, age 39. He has three children, all of whom attend school. He has been selling clothes for the last eleven years to make a living. He also operate a motorbike transport business to increase his income. He has employed one person to help him to run the business. 

Muema has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal, 33 years old, is a house wife. Her husband is a worker and earns $6 per day. The couple has two children, one is studying and one more is working in a restaurant and earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $105 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer for her yam plantation. She wants to sell grocery goods in front of her house when she can save enough money to start.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her yam plantation

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members, a brother and sister.  She is a retail mushroom farmer.  Betty works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She has requested a loan of 900000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more millet and mother spawn. Betty generates additional income by selling charcoal stoves and renting rooms. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build more rental houses and to become a big mushroom farmer. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy millet and mushroom spawn.

loans.name: Joseph Charo

texts.en: Joseph is a 34 year old single man. He describes himself as business-oriented and honest. He operates a restaurant where he sells food and snacks. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in Mishomoroni, a suburb of Mombasa, and his primary customers are students and teachers. He says his biggest business challenges are collecting debts owed by clients and insecurity. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to open another restaurant. His business goal is to run three more restaurants within 5 years.

loans.use: To open another restaurant

loans.name: Neri Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Neri pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 25 años de edad; la socia es soltera; La socia es ingeniero civil de profesión, ella trabaja  asistiendo las obras; la socia asiste como técnica de obras, ella tambien alquila dos canchones al publico en general, pero actualmente la socia desea invertir en construccion, la socia desea invertit el la primera etapa de construcción de vivienda, en los planos y certificaciones, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la construccion de viviendas en la fase 1 que son los papeleos, elaboracion de planos, certificaciones entre otras.

 
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
The member, Neri, belongs to Las Leonas de San Jerónimo Communal Bank, located in the district of San Jerónimo in the province and department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old and single.  She is a civil engineer by profession and works assisting the building work as a building engineer.  She also rents two large enclosed pieces of land ["canchones"] to the public in general.

Currently Neri wants to invest in construction, in first-phase home construction, in plans and certifications.  She wants to invest the loan in first-phase home construction, which is paperwork, plans, certifications, and other things.
 
She is happy about the loan granted and she thanks the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to invest in first-phase home building: paperwork, plans, certification, and other things.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is widowed and has eight children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has struggled to make a living by working in her rice field for thirty years to feed her children. For the past ten years she has supplemented her earnings by planting cassava. She currently earns less than 5 U.S. dollars a day and saves around two U.S. dollars a day after expenses.

This is Kean's first loan with VisionFund. She will use all of this 250 USD to buy cassava seedlings for her cassava plantation. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings for her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, aged 41, is married to Eliza, who is a teacher. He is blessed with two children aged ten and two. He has been selling livestock for the past five years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 5000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy more livestock to sell. Stephen hopes to be a large-scale dealer of livestock in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 21 años de edad, es Soltera y vive con sus padres en su modesta casa.
Silvia comenta que se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería, como ser calzados, prendas, prendas intimas, sabanas, frazadas, artículos navideños y demás. Nos cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela y por consiguiente muy buen ingreso, lo cual la ayuda a poder aportar en la casa y de esa forma aligerar un poco la carga de sus padres. Ella sueña con poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, calzados, zapatillas, artículos navideños y demás insumos para poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir abastecida para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Señora Silvia is of the city of Santaní.  She is 21 years of age.  She is a single woman and lives with her parents in their modest house.  Silvia tells us that she is dedicated to the sale of articles of clothing, such as footwear, garments, underwear, sheets,  blankets, Christmas articles and other things.  She tells us that she has a very good clientele and consequently very good income, which enables her to be able to contribute in the house and in that way lighten the load of her parents a little.  She dreams of being able to continue growing and in that way to have a little more income to continue helping her family.  She requests the loan for the purchase of garments, footwear, slippers, Christmas articles and other supplies to be able to continue growing and in that way to continue to be supplied so that she can satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy garments, footwear, slippers, Christmas articles and other supplies.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina, aged 33, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rodel, a driver, and is the mother of her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Monina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Monina dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.es: El cliente, Erwin, es un señor de 30 años de edad, es soltero, trabaja en una empresa de Criadores y engorde de ganado lechero en la ciudad de Cochabamba, que  queda ubicado en la zona este de la ciudad, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona oeste, aproximadamente a 2 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la refacción de su vivienda, la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, así mismo el suelo por la humedad se está rajando de su domicilio, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento,  es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The client, Erwin, is a 30 year old, single man.  He works for a firm that raises dairy cattle in the city of Cochabamba located in the eastern part of the city.  He lives in the western part about 2 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  The house he lives in is his and he lives with his wife and two daughters.

He will use the new loan from the institution to do some home repairs which is much deteriorated due to the passage of time.  The bottom part of the walls of the house are damaged because of dampness caused by the city’s constant rains as well as the very floor of the house that’s cracking due to dampness since this is the season of weather and the house needs to be repaired.  This is why we relate this small story about the client for all of you to be aware of.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she rears rabbits. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more rabbits. Her business goal is to be a great farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
I sell daily consumer goods and my grocery store is rather well known and I continue to attempt to keep my store well stocked with the items that sell the most. I am currently in need of stock with the end result being to better my earnings in order to support my children in their studies. My grocery store has a very good location in my neighborhood because it is on the main street and also next to a taxi stop.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi negocio es la venta de productos de consumo popular, mi pulperia es bastante conocida ya que siempre trato de tenerla surtida con los productos de mayor venta, ahora necesito surtirlo con el proposito de mejorar mis ingresos para apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios. Mi pulperia tiene buena ubicacion ya que es la calle principal de mi colonia y los taxistas actualemnte tienen su terminal aca.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, butter, milk, bread, refreshments, coffee, meats, chicken, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema Said lives in Tandika in Dar es Salaam and is married with two children. Rehema was trained in tailoring by a Baptist Church in Dar es Salaam. She now runs a tailoring business, specializing in women's and children's clothes. She employs one assistant, and would like to expand her business by adding two sewing machines and one more assistant. Rehema also sells eggs as a subsidiary business. She buys eggs from poultry keepers and resells them at retail. She would like to improve this business by adding trays for carrying eggs. To facilitate her two businesses, Rehema needs funding of $750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Koa

texts.en:
Mrs Koa M. is 42 and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She sells rice, khmer food and soft drinks and earns around 7 dollars a day. Her husband works for a private tourist company and earns 2 dollars a day. They have 2 children. 
She wants to purchase a motorcycle so that she can transport her stock more easily. In the future, she would like to increase the number of products she is able to offers her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elias is originally from Sabinas in Nuevo Leon, three years ago he became unemployed and, faced with the difficulty of finding new work, he decided to open up his own business selling sweets and novelty items for children. With this be able to obtain the basic necessities for his family. Elias is married and has two small children. He began by selling very few products but thanks to his hard work he was able to sell his wares to other shops and his sales have increased considerably, recently he has been able to obtain a truck in order to increase the distribution of his products. His wife also helps out with the business.

At this moment, Elias needs a loan of $925 dollars that will be dedicated to the purchase of merchandise in order to cover his clients’ demands and continue to grow as he has been. He promises to payback this money within 6 months. Become a part of the development of this business and help this family, they sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Elías es originario de la localidad de Sabinas en Nuevo León, hace tres años quedó desempleado y ante la dificultad para conseguir un nuevo trabajo emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y novedades para niños, y así obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, él está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Comenzó vendiendo muy pocos productos pero gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ahora surte a varias tiendas y sus ventas se han incrementado considerablemente, últimamente ha adquirido una camioneta para aumentar la distribución de sus productos y su esposa también le ayuda en el negocio.

En estos momentos Elías necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, él promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte del desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
At 41 years of age, Mrs. Abla E. is married to a taxicab driver and has two (02) children and one other person in her care. She ended her studies very early during elementary school to help her parents in their work. After getting married, she devoted herself to the small-scale sale of wood and charcoal. It is through this small business that she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. To improve the profitability of her commercial activity, she is asking for a loan of $800. This loan will allow her to set up a sufficiently large stock of firewood and charcoal during this time of abundance. She intends to repay this loan in 18 months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, Madame Abla E. est mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto et mère de deux (02) enfants avec une personne à charge. Elle arrêta très tôt ses études primaires au cours élémentaire pour aider ses parents dans leurs activités. Après son mariage, elle s’adonne aux petits commerces de bois et de charbons de bois. C’est par cette activité qu’elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges familiales. Pour améliorer la rentabilité de son activité commerciale, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Ce prêt lui permettra de constituer un stock suffisant de bois de chauffe et de charbons de bois en ce moment d’abondance. Elle compte rembourser ce financement en 18 mois.

loans.use: To stock charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Mrs. Clara U. has a business selling Garri. She goes to villages to buy Garri in large quantities, and then sells it to her customers in the city.

She worked with someone for 6 months and then started her own business in 1995. Mrs. U. requests a loan of $450 to buy more Garri to sell.

She is 44 years old, is married with 5 children, and live with her family in Benin City. She has been with LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: Buy more Garri to sell

loans.name: Ooy

texts.en: Ooy is a 42-year-old mother of 2 children, aged 30 and 25. She makes and sells an Indonesian salad called “gado-gado”, working from her small food stall from 8 am until the evening. She also sells meat balls and chicken noodles at her house. She usually earns US$30 per day. Her husband, S.,  works in the factory and can earn US$70 per month. Ooy is a member of MBK and requests a IDR 800,000 loan so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of food stall business

loans.name: Enuy

texts.en: Enuy, 20, is the mother of 3 sons. She sells home-made ice cream at her house and earns $5 a day, while her husband, J., sells the ice cream door-to-door on his wagon around the villages and earns $7 a day. As a member of MBK she is requesting a loan of $75 to buy supplies and expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business expansion

loans.name: Chacha Malengo Group

texts.en:
Chacha B., age 38, is married and has 4 children (ages 14, 10, 7 and 3). He has a poultry business which he started 8 years ago. He works from 7am to 4pm daily and has managed to make a monthly profit of about US$ 262.

In the past, Chacha has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand his business. He hopes for a new loan to buy food and medicine for the chicks. He will share this loan with his subgroup members who have businesses including shops and market stands.

In the picture, Chacha is 1st on the right--the tallest.

loans.use: to buy medicine and food for the chicks he raises

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with a son and a daughter. Her family is an ordinary, middle-class family from Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Victoria started her own business 10 years ago and has developed it into a stable and successfully growing trade. Currently, her income is about $400 a month. Victoria likes working in the food market and has many faithful customers. She operates her business with integrity and skill and is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. 

Victoria is hoping to get a loan of $800 to further develop her trade so that she can continue to feed her family. She would like to increase the assortment of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. This additional supply of inventory combined with Victoria’s work ethic and experience will enable her to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario S. is 46 years old, and he is married to Lucia Zuares. The couple has five sons, all of whom are adults.

Ever since he was a child, Mario has worked as a carpenter with his uncle. And, because of such previous experience, Mario gained extensive technical knowledge in the field.

Mario’s wife, Lucia Zuares, is a teacher. Over the years, the couple saved a considerable amount of money to further their entrepreneurial investments. Nowadays, Mario is the owner of his own carpentry operation. Mario’s dream is to buy a car in order to transport the furniture he makes, but at the present time Mario is merely seeking a loan to purchase raw materials for his business such as wood, nails, paint and other such inputs.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional raw materials such as nails, wood and paint

loans.name: Kankou

texts.fr:
Kankou Kouyaté is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and the children. She started working in commerce at an early age and (now) has thirty years of experience. Before joining the SORO YIRIWASO loan program, she had some difficulties running her business well because of meager working capital. With this loan, she expects to expand her business and to diversify it.

She gets her stock in Bamako at the Medina Coura marketplace from recognized wholesale merchants, and she sell it retail in Bougouni. She sells each day in Bougouni. The different goods are displayed in small piles or in small bags on a large table. Her customers are composed essentially of women who come to buy condiments each day to cook meals.

The turnover of her business is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 46,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Kankou Kouyaté ensures coverage of certain family expenses by helping her husband in particular.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Kankou Kouyaté est une femme mariée de 46 ans et mère de 5 enfants 2 garcons et 03 filles. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et les enfants. Elle a commencé les activités économique dès son jeune âge avec une experience de 30ans, Avant d’intégrer le programme de crédit de SORO YIRIWASO madame Kankou Kouyaté avait certaines difficultés pour menrer à bien son activité à cause de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement. Avec ce pret elle compte augmenter la taille et diversifier lson activité

Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako au marché de Medina Coura à Bamako, auprès de grossistes reconnus et revend à Bougouni. Elle vend tous les jours au marché de Bougouni. Les différents produits sont exposés en petit tas ou dans des sachets sur un grand étable Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes qui viennent acheter quotidiennement les condiments pour préparer les plats..

La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 46 000 FCFA. Grâce à ce bénéfice Madame Kankou Kouyaté assure certaines depenses de la famille en aidant surtout son mari.

loans.use: To buy and sell condiments

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T. is 51 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, she had lots of difficulties in life because she had too many children but did not earn enough money. In 1995, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed 20 USD at first. She used this money to raise the pigs and chickens. From 1995 to 2000, she continued to use the borrowed money on raising pigs, chickens and fish, earning 800 USD/ year. In 2001, seeing that local people and those living nearby enjoyed decorative plants, she switched to this activity. She bought the pots, the seeds and planted them. She distributed her plants to the hotels, and retailed. She also did not stop raising animals. Because the business went well, her family economy improved. She has 5 children, 3 of whom are grown-up and living separately, and the other two are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to invest more in the decorative plants business. Her average income is 400 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị T. năm nay 51 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ hoàn cảnh gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn, kinh tế eo hẹp do đông con lại trong độ tuổi đi học, thiếu vốn làm ăn. Năm 1995 chị T. tham gia Quỹ và vay vốn vòng một 300.000đ. Với mức vốn này chị đã sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn gà.Từ năm 1995 đến năm 2000 chị vay vốn của quỹ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà và thả cá T. nhập bình quân mỗi năm được 12.000.000đ. Năm 2001, nhận thấy người dân tại địa phương và các vùng lân cận có nhu cầu chơi cây cảnh cao gia đình chị đã chuyển sang kinh doanh cây cảnh, mua chậu, cây cảnh về chăm sóc và cung cấp cho các khách sạn và bán lẻ tại nhà, đồng thời gia đình chị vẫn tiếp tục chăn nuôi lợn ,gà, thả cá. Từ việc vay vốn đầu tư vào các dự án có hiệu quả đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá lên rất nhiều, chị có 5 con hiên nay 3 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng vợ chồng chị và đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh cây cảnh. T. nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in decorative plants business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mr. Chan M. is 30 years old and the father of three children one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is on the right of the photo.  His wife, Mrs. Thea Choeurn, sells bamboo in the local village. Mr. Chan M. is a motorbike-taxi driver in Tie Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His motorbike is too old and always needs to be repaired. To improve his business, Mr. Chan M. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for the business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for the business.

loans.name: Botur

texts.en:
Botur Y. is 30 years old and married with three children. Botur has been providing taxi services as a business for about five years. This business is the main source of income for his family. A hard worker, Botur gets up early and goes to bed late in an effort not to lose any clients. While he has no higher education, he dreams of being able to provide one for his children. His children are very talented and clever, and they are asking their father to buy them a computer.

In order to better provide for his family, Botur plans to fix his car and provide higher quality taxi services in the future and thus earn more money. Botur is requesting $600 USD that he plans to repay in twelve months. With the money, he will purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of his family is in your hands. If you help them by contributing to the growth of Botur’s business, they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for his car to improve his taxi business

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is 38 years old and married with two children, who are eight and five years old. She has been a chips and powder seller since 2007. She works every day from 7 am to 3 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Zabibu is now looking for a loan to expand her business and also start a new business.

loans.use: To expand her chips business and to start a new one.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en:
Dragana D. was born in 1971 and lives in Karanovac, a village in Bosnia outside of Petrovo. She is married with two children, one who is employed and one who is in primary school. Her husband and older son both work together as welders. The family lives together in one house, which is located on a corn field. Dragana grows and sells corn, raises pigs, and maintains a vegetable garden with which she helps to feed her family. She wants to start raising chickens to generate additional income, as a reserve for when the corn harvest does not yield adequate corn.

Dragana requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International. She will use this loan to purchase chickens and supplies for housing the chickens through the winter. She will feed the chickens with the corn and vegetables she grows in her fields, which is usually the highest expense for raising poultry.

She is a friendly, good-spirited woman, who immediately joked that it would be clear to everyone that she is a farmer, based on the clothes she is wearing in the photograph.

This loan is guaranteed by her friend, Zorica Ristić. If Dragana is unable to repay her loan, Zorica will cover the repayments.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and the materials needed to house the chickens through the winter.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolaza tiene 58 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos que la poyan. Su stand D. venta lo arrendó en una casa comercial ubicada en el centro D. su ciudad, venD. todo clase D. prendas D. vestir para damas jóvenes, por ello tiene que estar enterada D. lo ultimo en tendencias D. la moda, para que D. esa manera asegure las ventas diarias. Con esta actividad Nicolasa ya lleva 3 años y medio, le puso nombre a su establecimiento y se llama Boutique Chabela. Sus deseos siempre son el D. trabajar constantemente en su propio negocio, por eso no considera relevante los días en que las ventas puedan ser bajas, ya que hay días en las que se superan las metas. Para Doña Nicolasa es la primera vez que trabaja con esta forma D. préstamo, a la cual se compromete trabajar con mucha responsabilidad en la devolución  puntual con su crédito. Con este dinero podrá aumentar su capital D. trabajo, adquiriendo más prendas D. vestir para venderlas y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 58 years old and lives with her husband and four children. She rents a stall in a building in the center of town where she sells all manner of clothing for young ladies. To ensure her daily success she must be current with the latest fashion trends. Nicolasa has had her shop, named “Boutique Chabela,” for three and a half years. Owning her own business is her dream, so she is not discouraged on days when sales are slow. She is focused on days when she surpasses her goals. This is Nicolasa's first request for a loan of this sort, and she is committed to working responsibly to repay it on time. This loan will increase her working capital. With it, she will purchase more clothing to sell and will therefore increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
La señora Claudia María T. con mucho ahínco se dedica a su negocio de venta de mariscos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Ella se ubica en el sector mariscos donde atiende a sus clientes ofreciendo diferentes tipos de pescados y otros mariscos.

La razón por la cual hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de los mariscos y de esta forma contribuir al mejoramiento de su familia en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Ms. Claudia María T. works very eagerly in her seafood business in the central market of the city of Chinandega—her hometown. Her business is located in the seafood section, where she serves her customers, offering them different types of fish and other seafood.

The reason why she is seeking support from Ceprodel is that she needs to obtain a loan to purchase seafood and contribute to the betterment of her family in their household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seafood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mr. Horl H. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Tie Muoy village in Kandal province. He uses a horse to pull a cart to transport soil to re-sell. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his horse is too old which cannot help him to earn money to support the family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a new horse for his business. His wife, Mrs. Hay Srey, is a cleaner who can make only a little salary to support the family.

Mr. Horl H. is 28 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old. His wife is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new horse for his business

loans.name: Danny Villalobos

texts.es:
Danny Villalobos R. es un señor de 31 años de edad. Vive en una casa propia con su esposa. Aún no tiene hijos. Su familia se ha dedicado desde hace muchos años a la ganadería tanto para leche como para carne. Él siguió los mismos pasos y actualmente tiene una finca que es la que le ayuda a salir adelante. 
La comunidad en la cual vive Danny se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de unos dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano, sin embargo varias veces al año, el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que caen en la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en el Atlántico de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona.
Hace dos años, se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Por lo tanto, en los últimos dos años Danny ha ido especializándose en la producción de leche que luego vende a esta planta. 
El queso de la región donde vive Danny es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “Queso Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho comprar el queso Turrialba para comerlo en el desayuno junto con tortillas, arroz, frijoles y huevos. Por esta razón, el mercado para el queso que se hará con la leche que venda Danny es muy bueno.
Danny desea obtener un microcrédito para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más. Danny dice que sacará este préstamo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y de él en este momento y si con el paso de los años hay hijos que tengan una mejor calidad de vida y tal vez que ellos puedan tener la oportunidad de estudiar que él no tuvo.
Actualmente Danny ordeña a mano en una pequeña instalación de madera que acondicionó como sala de ordeño. Si aumenta la producción espera ir haciendo un local mejor y en unos años poder comprar un equipo de ordeño. También le gustaría ir mejorando los pastos con variedades más adecuadas para la producción de leche y así contar con una finca que le permita producir más.
Danny es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la microfinanciera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya 5 microcréditos y los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente. Los montos han ido incrementando desde los US$ 300, US$ 430, US$ 500, US$ 600 y US$ 700. Actualmente  Danny necesita un préstamo por $1.000 para comprar su vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Danny Villalobos R. is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. They do not have children yet. His family has had cattle for many years, for both milk production and meat production. He has followed the same path and now has a farm that helps him to get ahead. The community where Danny lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. It is a small, rural town of two thousand inhabitants. The people of the town work in milk production and coffee farming. The topography is hilly and most of the area is maintained as tropical rainforest. The town has very picturesque landscapes that combine the tropical forest with pretty ponds, coffee plantations, and dairies. El Sauce is located approximately one and a half hours by bus from Turrialba, the closest center of commerce. Even so, several times a year the road becomes impassible because of the rains. This is, without a doubt, one of the biggest challenges for the community. When there weren’t many jobs, many people chose to leave to look for work in Turrialba or in banana plantations located on the Atlantic coast of Costa Rica. Lately the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so now people from the area are looking for ways to invest in projects there. Two years ago a cheese processing plant was started by the Milk Producers Association of El Sauce. Because of this, for the past two years Danny has been specializing in producing milk that he then sells to the cheese factory. The cheese from the region where Danny lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a fresh cheese that is traditionally known as “Turriabla Cheese.” Ticos (a nick-name for the people Costa Rica) like to buy Turrialba cheese to eat it at breakfast, along with tortillas, rice, beans, and eggs. This is why the market for the milk that Danny sells, which is then made into cheese, is very good. Danny hopes to obtain a micro-loan to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase the milk production. He knows that having another cow is a big sacrifice and will require more work, but he says that if he wants to help his family get ahead, he’ll have to work hard to produce more. Danny says he will take out this loan to improve the quality of life for his wife and himself right now; if the years pass and there are children, he hopes they will have a better quality of life and maybe they can have the opportunity to study that he didn’t have. Currently, Danny milks by hand in a small wooden shed that he set up as a milking room. If his production increases, he hopes to construct a better building and then, in a few years, be able to buy a milking machine. He would also like to improve his pasture with varieties of grass that are better suited to milk production and in this way have a farm that will allow him to produce more. Danny is a client of the Producers Association of El Sauce, a local partner organization of the microfinance organization EDESA. Because of his ties to this organization, he has received 5 micro-loans and he has repaid them satisfactorily. The amounts have increased from US$300.00, to US$430.00, to US$500.00, to US$600.00, and to $700.00. Danny now needs a loan of $1,000.00 to buy his dairy cow.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is a 45-year-old married woman with four children.  To support her family, she sells medicine--in both wholesale and retail to her customers.  However, she hopes to expand this business, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more medicine for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional medicine

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
H. Jean est née en 1982 à Adjarra,département l'Ouémé; Jean réside dans cette même commune d’Adjarra. Jean est père de deux (02) enfants dont un scolarisé. La sauce de la viande de porc localement appelée « Han kpètè » est la sauce la plus consommée par les habitants de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Jean s’est donc lancé dans la préparation et la vente de cette sauce de porc. Jean a hérité cette activité de sauce de porc de son père. La clientèle de Jean s’accroît au jour le jour; mais il n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont dispose Jean sont faibles. Jean sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer son activité.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Jean was born in 1982 in Adjarra, Ouémé County. He resides in this same community of Adjarra and is the father of two children, one of whom is in school. The sauce made from pork locally called «Han kpètè» is the sauce most consumed by the people in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. And so he got started in making and selling this pork sauce. It is a business passed down from his father. Jean’s customers are growing from day to day, but he isn’t able to satisfy them because of the meager financial means he has. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to bolster his business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta K., age 29, is married and has two children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the villagers and public two days per week. She has had one previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Imeleta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used for her business.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, farming tools, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 50 year old widow, who has three children: Gemma is the eldest, 32 years old, a high school graduate. Leonardo, 30 years old, who is also a high school graduate and the youngest is Jeffrey, 27 years old, and a college undergraduate.  According to Alejandra, life has to move on, and whatever problems one encounters must be faced with courage and through the guidance of the Lord. She is happy that her three children are very supportive and have not left her side. 

Alejandra plans to pursue her food selling business.  She is requesting an amount of PHP 3, 000.00 that she will utilize for the improvement of her business.  She also sells snacks in her village.  Alejandra is still hoping that her youngest child will continue his studies and will somehow finish a vocational course.  She is working hard and striving to succeed in life.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara A. is married with one child. She has received an education through senior high school. She works as a trader selling provisions at Yamoransa in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2003. While Barbara is employed as a trader, her husband works as a driver.  Barbara will use her loan to purchase provisions in bulk or wholesale for the purpose of reselling. With her newly gained profits, she plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase provisions in bulk or wholesale for the purpose of reselling.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
