V. Nguyễn Thị  is 45 years old and lives in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has two school-age children.  To making a living, V. owns and operates a clothing business. V. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 2008, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services so she could improve her living situation.  V. successfully repaid her previous loan from TYM Fund. She used the loan to increase her working capital and to purchase additional inventory. V. is now requesting a new loan that she will use to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia K. is twenty-six years old and married, and currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Felicia’s husband is a professional teacher, while she is a seamstress. She designs and sews for clients and also creates clothing to sell. Felicia has a workshop on the street in her community. She says that at the moment she has two apprentices under training. Felicia has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies in bulk

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa S. lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is a student in a local university. Tsetsegmaa has a small food retail business in the town. She has a small convenience store located close to the local secondary school. She mostly sells convenient food products, including softdrinks, biscuits, candies, etc. Since the start in 2003, she has been doing well; her business capital has increased from 150,000 MNT to 2,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). As her store is located in the busy area of the town, product turnover is quite good. She usually purchases her products from the local wholesale market. With the profit, she was able to expand the building of the store. In the future, she would like to expand her business by offering more variety of food products that meet local demands.  
She requests a loan to purchase more food products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos I. O. vive en el municipio de Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. Santos tiene45 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos Luis de 17 años, Karina de 11 años y Josué de 7 años de edad, los tres niños se encuentran estudiando.  Santos lleva en sus hombros toda la responsabilidad para con sus hijos y por medio de su negocio es que ha logrado sostenerse y salir adelante todo el tiempo ya que Santos es un madre muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene su negocio en ventas de pupusas, el cual está situado dentro de su casa donde sus clientes potenciales son todos los vecinos de la zona que compran mucho de las pupusas de Santos, el destino del crédito que solicita Santos es para compra materia prima y así aumentar su producción de pupusas ayudando a obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Santos I. O. lives in the town of Sensuntepeque in the Cabañas district. She is a 45 year old single mother of three children: Luis – 17, Karina – 11, and Josué – 7. All three are students. Santos bears the entire responsibility for her children on her shoulders, and through her business, she has been able to sustain her family and move forward this entire time. She is a very responsible and hardworking mother. Her business involves making and selling pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) out of her home. Her potential customers are all her neighbors in the district who buy many pupusas.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy ingredients so that she can increase her production and earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To store and purchase grains

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo, Esteban, y sus hijos Alex de 13, Yoiri de 6 y Brigitte de 2 años y medio, todos viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como postres, empanadas, salchipapas, caldo de pollo y otros, en un pequeño puesto que tiene en el mercado Jerusalén, uno de los más conocidos de su distrito. Su esposo Esteban también trabaja, pero no tiene una actividad fija, es por ello que la labor que realiza Marina es muy importante para su hogar. Adicionalmente a su puesto de comida, también vende muñecas y hace manualidades para lograr ingresos extras, por ello Marina atiende a su clientela muy bien, ganándose muchos amigos y nuevos clientes, lo cual es la parte más bonita de su trabajo. Marina ya tiene 17 años en este negocio y quiere seguir mejorando, pues su deseo a futuro es tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa, aunque sabe que soñar es bueno, piensa que aún le falta mucho camino por recorrer. Este es su 13avo préstamo con MFP y en sus créditos anteriores siempre ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará sacos de arroz, fideos, papas y otros ingredientes para elaborar sus diferentes comidas.
texts.en:
Marina is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Estaban, and their children Alex (13), Yoiri (6) and Brigitte (2). For a living, she sells food such as deserts, empanadas, “salchipapas”, and chicken soup at a small stand that she has in the Jerusalén market, one of the most well known in her district. Her husband Esteban also works, but he doesn’t have a fixed job which is why Marina’s work is so important to the household. In addition, at her food stand, she sells dolls and makes handicrafts to earn extra income. Marina is attentive to her customers and has gained many friends and new customers, which is the best part of her work. Marina has been in this business for 17 years and wants to continue to progress. Her future desire is to have a restaurant which specializes in barbecued chicken. Although she knows it is good to dream, she thinks that there is a long road ahead of her before she gets there. This is her 13th loan with MFP and her previous payments have always been characterized by punctuality. With the money she is asking, she will buy rice, noodles, potatoes and other ingredients to make different foods.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of provisions and ingredients for meals

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba  es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica  que lucha por sus ideales, tiene  40 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motokar, ella trabaja con su esposo en su negocio de vulcanizado de llantas y repuestos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace dos años . Ella obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio de repuestos para motos y motokar. 
Con este crédito de S/. 2,300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un motokar. Su meta es agrandar su taller y comprarse otra compresora.
texts.en:
Elba is a dynamic, enterprising woman who fights for her ideals. She is 40 years old, and is the mother of three grown children. She sells motorcycle and motorcar (light, 3-wheeled vehicle) parts, working with her husband in his tire repair and spare parts business. She has been a member of the “Las Heroínas” communal bank for two years. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles, and this amount was invested in the opening of her motorcycle and motorcar parts business. With this loan of 2,300 soles, she will purchase a motorcar. Her goal is to increase her repair shop and to purchase another compressor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a motorcar (light, 3-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34 years old Asha M. from Mbeya . She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 8 and 14. Asha has been running a loc al restaurant  business since enter 2006 Client’s business is A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.
. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6  days per week 
 Asha currently earns about 90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at new location. Asha thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu K. is a single parent selling provisions and cosmetics.  Her shop and home are rented and her business is located at her house.

She has four kids plus her mother, whom she is taking care of. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy cosmetics and provisions (drinks) to increase sales in the shop.

She has spent six years in business and hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her kids and buy land for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and provisions

loans.name: Susmita

texts.en:
Mrs. Susmita L. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Susmita L. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Dolchoki. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize and snacks. She opened her grocery store to raise the living standard of her family. She is requesting a loan of 10000 NPR to buy different types of grocery goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different types of grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Jaahuu

texts.en:
Jaahuu G. is a 43-year-old married man, living with his wife and 6-year-old son in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His son currently attends a local secondary school.

With his wife's assistance, Jaahuu operates a consumer goods trading business and a small cafe in his town. More specifically, Jaahuu manages the consumer goods business, while his wife is responsible for running the cafe. Jaahuu and his wife started their food cafe in 2002. After several years of successful operations, he used his savings to start his consumer goods business in 2009. In particular, he imports products from China, such as clothing, twice per month to re-sell to local customers. He and his wife are very hardworking people, and they attribute their success to their good communication skills. Jaahuu has many plans for the future, and he hopes to grow his new business. He says, "My goal is to expand and maintain both of our businesses." He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 tugrug (approximately, $1,050 USD) to import additional clothes from China for his consumer goods business.

loans.use: To expand his business by importing additional clothes

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif N. is 22 years old. He is single but a responsible son of his family who relies on him. Vasif sells children's clothing in the center bazaar in Imishli city. Five years ago, he started as a seller. Gradually, he saved some money and with financial support of his dearest parents, he started his own business. Now he is a very experienced entrepreneur and manages his business, trying to keep his clients happy. The business is successful and generates a stable income for the family. Today, Vasif is requesting 1600 AZN for the purchase of new children's clothing for winter to sell. Vasif thanks everyone supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time. His biggest dream is to have his own family and he believes this loan will be a significant step to approach his dream.

loans.use: To purchase children`s winter clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Uok Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who live in Sman Muni village in Takeo province are members of this village bank. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Uok U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.35-hectare field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a silk middleman who buys silk to resell. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to resell. Her husband, Mr. Peong Pisey, is a farmer who cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Uok U. is a mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because this child is four years old.

loans.use: To buy more silk to resell

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep C., 39, is married and lives with her five-year-old child in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. C. sells dessert and groceries at a local market in her village. She is able to earn an income of USD $3.00 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2006. 

Her husband, who is a soldier, earns an income of USD $3.00 per day to help the family. C. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses and to reduce their daily expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Brigida Matilde

texts.es: La señora Brígida Matilde S. es maestra de educación secundaria donde cada día tiene que viajar hasta su lugar de trabajo, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar antes de iniciar a tener prestamos con CEPRODEL no tenían casa propia y con los prestamos han logrado tener su propia casa y hacer mejoras de la casa desde la instalación del agua, servicio eléctrico que han mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Brigida Matilde S. is a secondary school teacher where every day she has to travel to her place of work. She is a mother of a school-aged son. Before she started having loans with CEPRODEL she didn’t have her own home and with the loans she has managed to her own home and to make improvement such as the installation of water and electrical service that have improved their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, wood, paint and tin for home improvement

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Mrs. Esterlita B. is 59 years of age and a resident of Dumalogdog in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is already widowed. She is blessed with one child who is now an adult.

She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. This is her 7th loan she is borrowing 8,000 PHP. She will use her loan to buy additional products to sell.

She is struggling to look forward to a bright future for her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen E. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 37 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns an average of approximately 2,500 PHP monthly. In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy the rice farm that they had been leasing. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her rice field. This loan will be her 6th loan from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her rice field

loans.name: If I Had Known Group

texts.en:
Sonnie K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called If I Had Known Group.  She is 48 years old, married and has seven children who range from two to 35 years old.  Sonnie was never able to attend school because her parents refused to pay. For 35 years, Sonnie has been selling dried fish and palm oil at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia.  She says that she provides her customers with high quality dried fish and palm oil, which keeps them coming to her for business.  One of her challenges is that sometimes sales in the market can be slow. Sonnie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish and palm oil. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sonnie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:


The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and palm oil.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman with five daughters and one son, who is the oldest at the age of 24. Her daughters all attend school and her son has already finished his education.  She owns her home, which does not have electricity or piped water.  She is the breadwinner in the family.

Magdaline’s greatest monthly expenses are school fees and coconuts, which she has been selling for 19 years. To purchase coconuts, she visits her village, which is an hour away, once a week. She sells them outside, sometimes door-to-door. Her greatest challenge is transporting and at times obtaining coconuts, which can be scarce when the demand is high. As an additional source of income, Magdaline also buys and sells brooms to shops and passers-by.

With her 15,000 KES loan, Magdaline wants to buy more coconuts and pay for her children's school fees.  In the coming years, She hopes to become a wholesaler, improve her standard of living, and further educate her children.

loans.use: Coconuts

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is  married with five children and her children go to school.  Her husband is taxi driver in Kampala city.  She owns a four-roomed house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Safina takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.  She owns a restaurant and  a stall in Mulago selling bananas and all types of cooked food Safina sells to all categories of people  . She works seven days a week.  Safina receives at least 15 customers a day. Besides this food business, she also sells second hand clothes a stall near her restaurant . She has been in this business for many years.  She has been with MCDT for some for quite long. Safina‘s business challenges include thieves and transportation.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, meat and cooking oil and partly to buy more second hand clothes. She is aspiring of  seeing  her business grow big and  get  permanet business premise.

loans.use: Partly to buy bananas,cassava,potatoes and another part to buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Freecel

texts.en:
Freecel Q., 33 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by selling frozen food products and mineral water. She lives in GK Brgy Villareal Bayawan City, Negros Oriental with her husband and their three children who are between 7-13 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her frozen food products and mineral water businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Freecel is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can continue her frozen food products and mineral water businesses. This will be her fifth cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Freecel aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia Paredez de 28 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Arnaldo Gomez de 32 años de edad, ellos tienen dos hijas que aun no estan en edad escolar.
Doña Cecilia comenzó como vendedora  ambulante aproximadamente en el año 2.006; con el capital que consiguieron vendiendo unos electrodomesticos, fueron en busca de ofertas a otra ciudad y encontraron que la mejor opción para ellos es la venta de joyas y championes de buena marca, poco a poco fueron afianzandose y en la actualidad ya tienen una buena cantidad de clientes en la ciudad y zonas aledañas y venden sus mercaderias recorriendo varios luhares.
Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías(Championes y Joyas); teniendo en cuenta el pedido que tienen que cubrir.
texts.en:
Cecilia Paredez is 28 years old and she is married with Mr. Arnaldo Gomez, 32, and they have two daughters together who are still too young to go to school. Cecilia started her sales around the year 2006. With savings they earned from the sale of a few home appliances they went to another city in search for good deals. They decided the best option for them was to sell jewellery and brand name clothing. Slowly they started to be known and now they have a good client base in the city and in the suburbs. They sell their merchandise by travelling to different locales. She will invest her loan in the purchase of more merchandise (clothing and jewellery) to fill the orders that have already been placed.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale: athletic shoes, socks, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en: Benedictor is a happily married woman with one child who attends school and a husband who works with the Kenya Ports Authority. She has been operating her tailoring business for five years to add to her husband's salary. With the Ksh 40,000 she would like to buy clothing materials and sewing equipment. She faces seasonality as a major challenge. Benedictor hopes some day to have a big industrial unit of tailoring. She decided to join Yehu to acquire a loan to help her modify her business. She rents a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest expenses are food and a school fees.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and sewing equipment.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.fr: A. Nadine est née le 09 Mars 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nadine est mariée à DAAGBO Nicodème et est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Nadine vit avec son enfant à Cocotomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Nadine n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a près de huit ans que Nadine vend des mèches et des tissus à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Nadine vend des canaris, ce qui lui permet de se faire plus de revenus. Nadine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. C’est la première fois que Nadine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Nadine A. was born 9 March 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Nadine is married to Nicodème DAAGBO and is the mother of one child attending school. She lives with her child in Cocotomey, in the Abomey Calavi district. The couple shares the various family expenses. Nadine has only attended primary school. For the past eight years she has been selling hair extensions and clothing fabrics from her home. As a side business, Nadine also sells canaris (earthenware vessels), which provides an additional source of income. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and also in Lomé, Togo. This is the first time Nadine has requested a loan from ALIDé, with the intention of boosting her level of activity and increasing her turnover.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canaris (earthenware vessels) and hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase baked goods and telephone accesories

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Mery; ella tiene 39 años de edad y La socia es casada, su esposo es docente en la universidad, ella tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la artesanía, la socia tiene un stand en Pisac, populoso distrito de artesanos, La socia elabora cuadros, y otros adornos en cerámica desde el año 1997, ella junto a sus esposo han construido su casita con todo el esfuerzo de su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Mery; she is 39 and married. Her husband is a teacher at the university. She has 2 children and is an artist. She has a stand in Pisac, a crowded artists' district. She has made paintings and ceramic decorations since 1997. She and her husband built their little home together with all their hard work. She is requesting this loan to purchase basic materials for her business. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of basic materials for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal Azucenas y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Julia es casada y tiene 10 hijos, actualmente vive solo con su esposo, Julia vive en la comunidad D. San Juan D. la Frontera en donD. tiene tierras que cultiva produciendo flores, además se dedica a la crianza D. cuy para lo cual siembra alfalfa para la alimentación, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo lugar.
Julia solicita un crédito D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to Communal Bank White Lilies and what appeals to her the most is the incentive of saving. Julia is married and has 10 children but as of now lives only with her husband. Julia lives in San Juan D. la Frontera where she has land that she cultivates to produce flowers. She also raises guinea pigs for which she grows alfalfa to feed. She makes her sales in the same location. Julia is requesting a 1500 Peruvian Soles loan to purchase a balanced animal feed.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a balanced feed.

loans.name: Reyna Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Araceli G. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa, juguetes y zapatos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que al negocio le está haciendo falta variedad de mercancía y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingresos para ella y sus dos pequeños hijos que tiene y están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Reyna Araceli G. has more than two years' experience in selling clothing, toys and shoes. She requests a loan to supplement her business with merchandise. She does not have the capital funds to make that investment on her own. She plans on making her payments from the earnings of her business. It is the only source of income for her and for her two young children who are in her care.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchanise to restock her business.

loans.name: Peter  Mureu

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old gentleman married to Mrs. Wanjiru and they have four children who all go to school. Peter has been in the business of selling used clothes and other household items for eighteen years. He says he has gotten the strength to move on through his wife who is also a hardworking businesswoman.

Peter plans to use this first loan to buy additional used clothes and also diversify by buying used shoes and household items.He plans to own a wholesale shoe shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio C. A. es un hombre muy responsable con su trabajo que realiza su actividad como carnicero desde hace 4 años. En este momento el recurre a esta institución pidiendo el apoyo para poder arreglar el techo de su vivienda pues con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y a causa de esto cuando llueve se trasmina el agua, lo cual ya necesita reparación para que este en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Antonio C. A. is a very responsible man in his job as a butcher, which he has had for the last 4 years.  At this time he is asking for support to fix the roof of his house. It has been deteriorating over time and now leaks when it rains, so it needs to be repaired soon.

loans.use: Reparar techo de madera

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos is 44 years old and lives in a very populated neighborhood in the town of Ita with his wife, Lorenza, and his school-age son. 
Juan is a carpenter and has his shop at home where he makes all kinds of furniture like tables, chairs, nightstands, armoires and others. He sells to street vendors and also takes special orders. He has been in business for 15 years and during this time has been able to acquire many tools and machinery needed. 

He has been a good client of Fundacion Paraguaya and this time he asks for credit to start selling charcoal. Juan says this activity will generate additional income. He already made a cart and has a horse to transport the charcoal to the market and sell it.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank "The little stars of gold II", located in the district of Puno, in the province and department with the same name. She is 26 years old, and a single mother of one child. She has a complete higher education degree. 

She works with handicrafts such as hand-woven sweaters, cardigans, and gloves. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for 500 PEN and she used the money to invest in her business. 

Now she is asking for a new loan for 100 PEN, a loan that will allow the purchase of wool to make cardigans. 

Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes about the Communal Bank is the earnings on her savings.

loans.use: The purchase of wool to make cardigans

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las Luchadoras se denomina el excelente grupo donde la Directora General  es la Sra.  Cristina G., quien tiene una despensa hace 3 años está casada tiene 7 hijos, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la  Fundación Paraguaya.
La Señora Cristina se siente muy contenta con su grupo y asegura que seguirá trabajando con el comité. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa como, harina, fideos, arroz, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
“Las Luchadoras” (The Fighters) is known for being an excellent group. Sra. Cristina G. serves as its General Director. She has managed a food pantry for three years and is married with seven children. Cristina contacted an advisor at one of the weekly meetings held in her area about how she could join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. After learning about the program, she was able to gather 16 women who enjoy working and now they are in their first loan cycle. They work together in the program as a single unit. All of the members participate in fundraising activities so that they can reach the common goals they share with one another and with Fundación Paraguaya.

Sra. Cristina is very happy with her group and says that she will continue working with her committee. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her food pantry such as flour, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase flour, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto de 22 años, brinda el servicio de cyber desde hace más de 2 años. Actualmente tiene 8 maquinas el brinda el servicio al público en general, pero lo que más llegan son los estudiantes él les proporciona una tarifa muy económica. El inicio por su familia quienes lo apoyan en este tipo de actividad, con el tiempo el ha logrado mejorar su negocio actualizando las computadoras y otra cosas. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de computadoras, por lo que tiene demanda de parte de sus clientes.  En el futuro quiere obtener un buen negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carlos Ernesto is 22 years old and he has been providing internet service for the past 2 years.  He currently has 8 computers and provides service to the general public, although the ones that use it the most are the students.  He charges them a very economic rate.  He started this business for his family who support him in this activity.  In time he has been able to improve his business, getting updated computers and other equipment.  The purpose of the loan is to buy computers to cover the demand from his customers.  In the future he wants to have a good business and improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Danelia es una pequeña comerciante con su propio negocio, una pulpería en donde lleva varios años vendiendo. El cual ah apoyado a sus cinco hijos y ha venido creciendo su nivel de ventas gracias a los financiamientos que la institución ha dado. En donde ha invertido en variedad de alimentos de consumo.
Se ha esforzado mucho ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo hoy en día. Con el objetivo de este crédito es para aumentar productos ya que tiene pocos debido a que muchos clientes que da al crédito todavía no le han pagado y eso le genera pérdidas. Los productos a comprar: granos básicos, golosinas, productos lácteos, productos de aseo entre otros. Que le generen mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Daniela is a small businesswoman with a business of her own: a grocery store where she’s been selling for years and has supported her five children.

Its sales level has been increasing thanks to the loans the institution has granted that have been used to invest in a variety of food items.

She has struggled much because she does not have any support from her husband.

The point of the loan is to increase her stock of products because she’s down to just a few because many of the customers she sells to on credit haven’t paid back yet and this generates losses.  

The items she wants to buy are: basic grains, sweets, dairy products and cleaning supplies, among others that will produce better profits.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila es socia del Bancomunal Ccatarisun, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 2 hijos de 22  y 9 años. Zoila es feriante, viaja a la Selva San francisco y sus anexos, atiende sólo pedidos y le va bien. Está en Finca hace 2 ciclos y le gusta por los créditos que le otorgan, puede ahorrar y le gusta la capacitaciones porque se tratan temas de la familia, negocio, derechos de las mujeres. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pescado y abarrotes en general
El sueño de zoila es capitalizarse y que su negocio siga creciendo, que su hijos sean profesionales y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the Ccatarisun Communal Bank, is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 22 and 9. Zoila is a saleswoman, she travels to Selva San Francisco and its surrounding area, taking only orders and her business is going well. She has been with Finca for 2 cycles and she like receiving the loans, being able to save money, and she likes the educational offerings because they relate to issues of family, business, and women’s rights. The loan that she seeks will be invested in buying fish and groceries.

Zoila dreams of becoming self-supporting and that her business continues to grow, that her children become professionals and have their own homes.

loans.use: Buy fish and groceries

loans.name: Bujintuul

texts.en: Bujintuul is 27 years old and lives with her parents and two children in a house and fence in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 4, is in a kindergarten and her husband currently lives and works in Korea. Bujintuul operates a leather paintings and goods manufacturing business. She makes a variety of leather paintings and souvenir products such as slipper, key chain and bag etc, to sell at the local markets. She started her business in 2006 after working as a painter for the "Mon-Tulga" company since 2003. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase leather cutting machine to make her souvenir products.

loans.use: To purchase leather cutting machine

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Mrs. Yeth K. is a married woman born in 1959 and living in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and husband, Mr. Yat K., are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. She also sells Khmer cakes. In the rice field, she has the problem of infertile soil. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Yeth K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer, and the other a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Azucena Monserrate

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Azucena, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 7años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es policía. Lleva en el Banco Comunal  ya por tres ciclos y  le gusta porque los créditos salen  rápido y sin tantos requisitos y papeleos.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumes, cosméticos y otros accesorios).  Además de esto también se dedica a la venta de sandalias y zapatos de todo tipo. Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas por dia, lo que es sandalias y zapatos se los traen desde otras ciudades a precio para comerciantes, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva en esta actividad ya por tres años y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, sandalias y zapatos de temporada. Sus sueños son tener un taxi nuevo ya que tienen uno pero ya está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the community bank Las Piedras meet in the neighbourhood of Las Piedras located in the parish of Picoaza in the town of Portoviejo. The town is known for its traditional culture, for its happy people, and for its San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations. 

40-year old Señora Azucena is a member of the bank. She lives common-law with her husband and has two children aged 11 and 7 who attend school. Her husband is a policeman. 

Azucena has been with the bank for three loan cycles. She likes it because she can get a loan quickly and without too much paperwork. She sells Yangal beauty products such as perfumes, cosmetics, and accessories. In addition she sells all types of sandals and shoes.  Azucena works 2 to 3 hours a day three days a week. The footwear is brought in from other towns at dealer prices. She’s been doing this work for three years and is doing well.

The loan will be used to buy perfume, lotions, cosmetics, sandals and shoes appropriate for the season. Azucena’s dream is to have a new taxi as the one she has is somewhat dilapidated.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, cosmetics, and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing mutton for cooking traditional food dishes to sell.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members -- her late sister’s children. Safina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity yet no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family.

To earn a living, Safina has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 7 days per week. Safina sells her products in a retail shop. She explains that her main business challenges include seasonality and perishability. Safina generates additional income by renting rooms.

Safina is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings ($425) from MCDT SACCO. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more boxes of cabbages, onions, and tomatoes. In the future, she hopes to work directly with farmers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from Rafah, married and a father of two little sons. Ahmad distributes goods and items to stores and cafeterias.

Ahmad used to save a fixed amount of his income and he came to FATEN to take out a loan in order to purchase a van that would help him distribute larger amounts faster and thus save time.

Ahmad appears in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase a van to distribute food items.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna B. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Donna is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Donna owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products. Donna has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Donna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Donna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Donna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Donna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel's Group

texts.en:
Manuel N. is from the village of Lalog 2, Luna, Isabela. He is 43 years old. Manuel is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Manuel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Manuel owns & operates a business providing plumbing repairs in the local community. Manuel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Manuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Manuel is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials needed, such as pipes. This loan will be his 5th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for his plumbing business

loans.name: Bolen

texts.en:
Bolen D. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old.  Bolen is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Bolen owns & operates a business buying and raising pigs for sale. Bolen has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bolen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bolen is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bolen from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 42 years old and earns her living through farming.  She is married with four children, the oldest of whom is 12 years old.  She tills her own land in Banga, South Cotabato, where she grows rice and corn.  Lenora sells her harvest at the market.  Leonora hopes to be able to sustain her children's education. 

Lenora plans to use the requested loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.  She hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tukore Group

texts.en: 32 year old Abert has been teaching for the past 3 years in Ntungamo district, in Western Uganda. The father of 2 says he began teaching after he finished his teaching course at university. On the side, Abert also has a modest retail business that he runs. With 3 years in his teaching job, he has solidified his insight on the virtues, ethics and benefits of giving people an education. Notwithstanding the low remuneration that most teachers get, Abert has never been one that wavers in his desire to give people knowledge that will, at length, help them in their lives. This attitude alone is a selling point for him. Monthly, he says, his profits are to the total of shillings 300,000. Abert says that with this loan, he intends to purchase more retail commodities to resell at his modest retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell at his modest retail shop.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos de 34 años de edad, padre ejemplar de un hijo, acompañado de su amada señora, residen en la ciudad de Itá. El junto a su familia se dedica al servicio de taxis en dicha ciudad, hace ya como 6 años. Actualmente tiene dos vehículos en circulación, uno que está en el centro de la comunidad y el otro en el cruce de la compañía de la cuidad de Itá.
Él cuenta que en el negocio le genera muy buena ganancia por el gran movimiento de personas que existe en la zona, lo cual para dar un buen servicios a los pasajeros debe mantener el vehículo en buenas condiciones para poder brindar la comodidad a los mismos. Por todo esto solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus automoviles, como así también para las reformas que estos pudieran necesitar.
Su objetivo prioritario es de crecer como micro empresario y de ver a sus hijos ser alguien importante el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos, 34, is a model father of one child, along with his beloved wife. They reside in the city of Itá. Along with his family he works providing taxi services in said city, which he has done for about six years now. Currently he has two vehicles in circulation, one in the community's downtown area and the other at a crossroads in the neighborhood of Itá. 

He tells us that he makes very good earnings in the business because of the great mobility of the people in the area. Therefore in order to provide good service to the passengers he must maintain the vehicle in good condition so that the ride will be comfortable. For these reasons he is seeking the loan to maintain his automobiles, as well as for any reconditioning they may require. 

His priority is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and to see his children be someone important in the future.

loans.use: to maintain vehicles.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en: Stellah, a 26-year-old hardworking lady, has been operating a grocery store for four years thanks to the the financial support of Faulu Kenya. Now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy crates of eggs, her dream is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs.

loans.name: Javier Fabian

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

Aquí conocimos a Javier él es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero y en la actualidad aun vive en la casa de sus padres.

Se dedica al comercio, él vende frutas  y para esto primero se desplaza a los campos a recolectar de los agricultores sus productos, luego los lleva al mercado de Tarqui en Manta donde vende sus productos a las personas que asisten todos los días hasta este lugar para realizar sus compras diarias, esto lo realiza los fines de semana pero el resto de la semana en su casa el elabora figuras en tagua, las mismas que luego las lleva a vender en las playas de Manta y también viaja hasta Ambato donde vende sus productos a turistas y personas de estos lugares que aprecian sus obras.

Este crédito es para comprar plátanos, naranjas, papayas y tagua para elaborar sus obras. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y seguir trabajando para tener un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Javier. This hardworking young man is 24 years old, single, and currently lives at home with his parents.

Javier is a fruit merchant. First, he goes to the fields to collect his merchandise from the farmers. Javier then brings his merchandise to the Tarqui Market in Manta where he sells to the people who come every day to make their daily purchases. He sells fruit on the weekends, so during the rest of the week, Javier is at home making figurines out of “tagua” (a material derived from a certain palm tree that has the appearance of elephant ivory). He sells the figurines on the beaches of Manta. Javier also travels to Ambato to sell his figurines to tourists and to locals who appreciate this type of work.

This loan will be used to buy bananas, oranges, papayas, and tagua for making his creations. Javier is participating in his second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the assistance that the loans have provided. His dreams are to own a house and to continue working in order to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, papayas, and tagua.

loans.name: Jane Kerubo

texts.en: Jane is a widowed lady with four children aged between 3 and 16. She sells cereals at Nyalenda market in Kisumu. She has been running this business for five years now. She says that the business is profitable and the major challenge she faces is lack of sufficient capital to increase stock. Jane is using the loan to purchase cereals to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale and become a supplier of cereals, as well as diversify into a supermarket. Jane describes herself as sociable and humble.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ishenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Ishenbubu, who leads this loan group, is 48 years old and married to a farmer. She and her husband have two sons, one of whom helps his father raise livestock while the other pursues his studies. Four years ago, the family started to breed livestock with an initial investment of 20,000 soms. They now earn about 12,000 soms a month by selling the animals they have raised. These profits have allowed Ishenbubu to buy furniture for her home and start building a shed for her livestock. She will use her portion of this loan to buy more livestock to breed. Her long-term goal is to build a house in Bishkek for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and see a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mejor Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mejor Progreso lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras  una de ellas es la señora Ligia, coordinadora del grupo ella se dedicada a la compra y venta de perecederos en especial tomates en los que invertirá en tres cajas de tomate entre lo prestrado y sus ganancias.

Las otras integrantes son Mayra quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y chinelas y Melania  vende frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The Mejor Progreso group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. Mrs. Ligia is one of them. She is the group coordinator, and her business is buying and selling perishable items, especially tomatoes. She will invest in three boxes of tomatoes.
The other group members are Mayra, who sells clothing and flip flops; and Melania, who sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a 42-year-old married man with nine children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him, and his desire is to finish building the house and educating his children.

He has been in the bakery business for ten years and he generated the initial capital from selling two of his cows. His hardship is price fluctuations and his vision is a modern bakery that meets international standards.

Joram needs the loan to buy wheat flour for baking and also to complete his house.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and finish the house.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Morena, se dedica a vender mariscos y pollo, desde hace dos años tiene este negocio y su esposo le ayuda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 8 años, todos los días salen a repartirlo a sus clientes de lunes a domingo.
Ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar en sus ganancias y también tener más clientes y ofrecerles variedad y comprar más mariscos como: curiles, punches, pescado, chacalines, camarones.
El sueño de Morena es tener un negocio más grande y variedad para que su familia estén bien y sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Morena works selling seafood and chicken.  She has had this business for two years, and her husband helps her with it.  She lives with her husband and two children, aged 13 and 8.

She needs the loan to increase her earnings and also to have more customers and offer them variety.  She will purchase more seafood such as clams, crabs, fish, and shrimp of various kinds.

Morena's dream is to have a bigger business with a variety of products, so that her family can be well and her children can attend school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seafood: fish, shrimp and crabs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 36 years old, resides in Siem Reap province, which is known as a province that is full of ancient temples and tourism. She is an animal seller and earns $6 per day. Her husband is a bread seller and earns $10 per day. This couple has four children and all of them are studying in school. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $20 on school fees and $15 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a tok-tok (a motorcycle-based taxi) for doing a tok-tok service when her husband is free from selling bread. This loan will help her family to have a new career that will make more income. She wants to have a shop in the market to sell bread when she has enough money. For her children, she will support them to study in the university.

loans.use: to buy a tok-tok for doing a tok-tok service

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a diligent mother. She works as a full time Barangay Health Worker. To increase her earnings, she works part time direct selling cosmetics such as make up, colognes and perfumes to the people in her village. Through the profits earned from this business, she was able to continuously send her child to school. She has four children but only one of them got the opportunity to study, the rest have their own family. 

Avelina is now 56 years-old and she is asking for a loan amount of P15,000 in order to buy additional items to sell such as lotion, colognes, perfume, lipsticks and shampoo. 

In the future, she wants to improve her sales and earn enough income for the college education of her child.

loans.use: to buy lotion, colognes, perfume, lipsticks and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Aunofo

texts.en:
Aunofo is 62 years of age and married with eight children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Aunofo needs a loan of 1000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Aunofo joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aunofo's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Qafar

texts.en: Qafar is 43-year-old man who raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has 15 years of experience in this field. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar, an Internally Displaced Settlement. He is married and has two children. His wife actively helps him to run the business. Qafar usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. He applied for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: El Cerrito El Carmen Group

texts.es:
La señora Flory Marizela es casada, estudio la educación básica, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la sastrería a la confección D. vestidos para damas, inició su negocio vendiendo ropa y haciendo costuras y al momento lleva 13 años D. experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a ser piloto.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra telas e hilos y tener mas producción, espera en el futuro tener un local propio y suficiente capital. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la tejeduría, venta D. ropa, al comercio y ate4nciob a tienda.
texts.en:
Flory Marizela is married and completed her primary education.  She has four children who are in school.  She works as a seamstress, making ladies' dresses.  She started her business selling clothes and sewing, and has 13 years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a driver.

Flory Marizela set up a group to request a loan so that she could buy fabrics and threads, and thereby produce more.  She hopes, in the future, to own her own premises and have enough capital.  The other members of the group weave, sell clothes, buy and sell products, and run stores.

loans.use: to buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
La señora Delmy tiene 32 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Rio Chiquito en el departamento Cortes. Ha pasado los últimos 4 años junto a su pareja Luis, lo cual es cajero. Delmy tiene dos hijos: una niña de 11 y un niño de 13 años de edad y ambos están estudiando. 

Delmy inició su negocio en 2010, debido a la necesidad de obtener otro fuente de ingreso para su familia. Lo empezó con ahorros de la familia y un crédito que solicitó en ODEF. Delmy trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 9:30 de la noche todos los días. Vende útiles escolares, novedades, y golosinas. 

Solicitó este crédito de L13,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de golosinas y novedades. Delmy espera superarse cada día más en su negocio y así dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Delmy is 32 years old and lives in the village of Rio Chiquito in the department of Cortes.  She has spent the last four years with her partner Luis.  He is a cashier.  Delmy has two children; a daughter of 11 and a son of 13, and they both attend school.

Delmy started her business in 2010, due to the necessity of finding another source of income for her family.  She began it using family savings and a loan that she requested from ODEF.  Delmy works from 6 in the morning until 9:30 at night, every day.  She sells school supplies, novelties, and candy.

She requested this loan of L13,000 to stock up her inventory by purchasing candy and novelties.  Delmy hopes to do better and better with her business on a daily basis, and so be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy and novelties.

loans.name: Kabuluru Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is the facilitator of the Kabulolo group. Everlyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a good maize yield harvesting 5½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and pay back her loans.

In 2012, the members of Kabulolo group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Everlyne is pictured with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: God Bless Smt Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless SMT” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Iye. Iye is age thirty-four. She was born in Lunsar town, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a shoemaker and three of her children are attending secondary school. 

For six years now, Iye has been selling biscuits, cigarettes, chewing gum, etc. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, cigarettes, chewing gum, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Ruth Constanza

texts.es: Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas, tiene 52 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas y ollas en la ferias, es madre de 3 hijos, es casada y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 10 años. Antes ella sufrió con su negocio, pero ahora gracias  las capacitaciones que le dieron en su Banco Comunal pudo aprender y ahora esta muy bien con su negocio, y todo lo que tiene es gracias a el ahorro, antes la mantenía su esposo ahora ella es autosuficiente, aprendió a trabajar sola, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ollas.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Hormigas ["Ants"] Communal Bank. She is 52 and sells clothing and pots in various markets. She is married with three children and has been a member of Finca Peru for ten years. She once had problems with her business, but now thanks to the loans she has taken out of her communal bank, she was able to learn and now runs her business much better. Everything she has is thanks to her savings. Her husband used to take care of it but she is now self-sufficient. She learned to work independently.
She will use this loan to buy pots.

loans.use: to buy pots.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent, aged 24, is single and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumption. 

For the past six years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Milicent dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Peterson M.'s Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are teachers of a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These diligent and hard-working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 10,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to help them pay school fees for their children, invest in businesses, buy pieces of furniture, buy a plot of land, etc. 

At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Peterson is the leader of this group of teachers. The 50-year-old is a native of Ganya Sulima village. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children. Peterson has served in the teaching profession for 29 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like bags of cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a house. He will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a house, and to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Galo

texts.en:
Baking has long been the family trade for the Santianas. As a youngster Galo helped his father at his bakery and then worked for another family member until three years ago when he decided to open his own bakery. His sister Monica, who is also a baker and a Kiva borrower, helped him out by providing the oven and finding a spot for his business. Now he and his wife work everyday from 5 am until late in the night. They are seeking a loan in order to invest in raw ingredients such as flour and baking soda. He wants to also buy the ingredients to make Christmas bread for upcoming holiday season.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Baking ingredients

loans.name: Galileo

texts.en:
O. is married and has two children, and one child is going to school. He started his business with a $200 loan from his cousin. Since then, he has been supplying the building stones by buying on credit and repaying after selling.

Given the loan, he intends to restock the stones as they are in high demand in Kisumu as more buildings are going up.

He takes care of two children from his deceased brother. He intends to use the profits to build his own house and buy medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: Buy more building materials

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng S. is 33 years old and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away and she now has to support the family herself.  She runs a baby-sitting organization where she watches the children of friends and neighbors in the village.  This business generates about $12.00 per day for S..  She hopes to use this loan in order to buy pigs to raise.  Additionally, S. wants to use the loan to purchase rice in to make rice wine--a Cambodian specialty.  After using rice to make this wine, the rice is then fed to pigs, which become fatter much more quickly.  In the future, S. would like to expand her rice making/pig raising business by buying even more pigs to feed.  Eventually, she hopes she will be able to send her children to a university.

loans.use: Buy rice for her rice making and pig raising business.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. He has a bakery in Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase a new bakery machine and hire two jobless people. Also he wants to paint the shop and purchase new equipment for the bakery. He wants to develop his bakery and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new oven

loans.name: Sophoan

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Sophoan was married in 1998 and has 2 children, 1 daughter and 1 son. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor before she got married in 1998 and started her silk production at that time. She trained her husband, Mr. Yim Sophath to weave as well. Now, her husband is  assisting her in  weaving silk after he finishes his day of growing vegetables and raising cows.  

She requests a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and setting up another loom for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and set up another loom for her husband.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Selling the simple necessities of everyday life is a business that Mrs. Ablavi A. inherited from her mother when she was still very young. Now, at age 37, she herself is married and mother of three children. This very lucrative business permits her to support her family financially, since her husband, who is a farmer is not able to do so because his income is meager.

Very dynamic and conscientious in her position as principle breadwinner for her family, Mrs. A. is always trying to do better by her children. For that reason, she would like to vary her inventory and build a little kiosk to sell out of, so that her little general store can become better known in her neighborhood. This will permit her to increase her income so that she can better care for her children whom she loves so much. She is very concerned about their future and especially their schooling, because she herself is illiterate and knows that that makes life very difficult indeed. To accomplish these goals, Mrs. A. is asking for a loan of US$ 700.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

La vente des produits de premières nécessités est une activité que Madame A. Ablavi a hérité de sa maman depuis son jeune âge. Aujourd’hui, âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Cette activité très rémunératrice, lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famille car son mari cultivateur n’arrive pas à remplir sa responsabilité de père de famille à cause de la faiblesse de son revenu.

Très dynamique et étant consciente de son titre de mère de famille, elle cherche toujours à mieux faire pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Ainsi donc, elle voudrait augmenter son étalage et construire un kiosque pour mieux se faire connaître dans sa zone. Ceci va lui permettre d’améliorer son revenu pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants qu’elle aime tant. Car elle tient beaucoup à leur avenir surtout à leurs études parce que son analphabétisation ne la profite pas. Pour réaliser ce projet, elle sollicite un crédit de $700.

loans.use:
building a kiosk and increasing her inventory

construction d'un kiosque et approvisionnement de marchandises

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margaret E. is 40 years old.  She is married with 5 children, and lives in Benin City.  She sells plywood.  She trained in business for a year and established her own business in 1999.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy more plywood for sale.  She has been a LAPO member for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Surrounded by her customers we see Mrs. Dina, selling her delicious and nutritious quinoa and maca juices. She starts her business daily routine at 4:00 am and finishes at 11:00 am; this business has allowed her to improve her life style and has innumerable plans for her two children’s future.
