Cristy J. is from the village of Mobod. She is 36 years old. Cristy is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Cristy owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2001, Cristy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Cristy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house & store. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina S. is 35 years old, single, and has no children. She is a very strict and hardworking lady. For the last two years, she has been running a general store where she sells products such as soft drinks, bread, sugar, rice and hair extensions. She sells her products to local people, schools and colleges. Her business is located at Khayega in Kakamega, in a busy market along a busy road. In addition to her general store, she also provides computer services.
Carolina works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure her business' success in a market where there are many other traders engaging in the same kind of business as hers. Her major challenge is lack of funds, and that is why she is requesting a loan to increase her stock in order to grow her business. Carolina is also using her loan to start up a car wash to generate extra income. Her hope is to improve her living standards and build a beautiful house for herself. She also dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, rice and beauty products to sell

loans.name: San Andres Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento "SAN ANDRES " es uno del los grupos  màs antiguos D. la agencia , se encuentra en su octavo ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

La Sra. Martha es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. hamburguezas  en la calle Pedro Ceballos en villa Pagador . Esta casada y tiene 1 hija que se encuentra en edad escolar y la Sra Martha corre con todos los gastos del hogar.

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra Silvia ella es viuda  su esposo murio en un accidente D. transito y tiene 6 hijos su negocio es  venta D. empanadas  en la Av. Petrolera ,es una persona muy responsable y puntual, su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales ya que ella trabaja duro para dar una  vida mejor a sus hijos.

La secretaria es la Sra Rielmy ella soltera no tiene hijos y  tambien tiene el negocio D. venta D. empanadas  ella es joven muy  activa y responsable.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Andres" is one of the agency's oldest groups, maD. up of responsible and hardworking people. This bank is currently in its eighth loan cycle and is represented by the following members: Martha is the leader and founder of the group. She has a hamburger business on Pedro Ceballos street in the town of Pagador. She is married and has one daughter, who is of school age. Martha takes care of all the domestic expenses. The secretary's name is Silvia. She is a widow whose husband was killed in a traffic accident. She has six children, and for a living she sells empanadas on Petrolera Avenue. Silvia is a very responsible and punctual person, and her desire is to see her children become professionals, since she works really hard to give them a better life. Rielmy is the bank's secretary. She is single with no children, and also has an empanada business. She is young, very active, and responsible. All of the members are appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to them through the grant of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla N. is from the village of Sta. Claro Road, Barangay 20, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Priscilla is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Priscilla owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Priscilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Priscilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny G. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Beatingo, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store. Jennie’s husband, Francis, works as a caretaker of the fish ponds. They have two children, 6 and 9 years old, who are currently going to school while helping their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Jenny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Jenny is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 5,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 9,000 for her 4th loan, which she intends to use for her general store. Jenny is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en: Servilla S. is from the village of Owaon. She is 55 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Servilla owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month. In 2007, Servilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Servilla is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mr. Ben Chi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of ten members, is located in Prey Run village in Takeo province. Mr. Ben C. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who all plan to use their loans for different purposes.

Mr. Ben C. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. His wife is a wine and gasoline seller in the local village. He is the father of three children, two of whom are teachers, while the third attends the local public school. Mr. Ben C. is facing some obstacles because his rice field is infertile but he does not have enough money to improve it. Thus, Mr. Ben C. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer. He would use the rest of the loan to start a new business and buy three piglets for breeding . Mr. Ben C. is busy with his rice field so his wife came instead of him to take out the loan .

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à Siekourani un village de la sous préfecture de LOULOUNI   région de Sikasso 3 e région du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’agrandir leurs activités. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers, condiments, charbon de bois et  de céréales telle le riz   avec Machitan B..
Machitan B. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  4sacs de 50 kg de riz . Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les foires des villages voisins. 
Le riz est revendu en détail au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 6 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités commerciales.
texts.en:
The eight women in the Jiguisseme group are all of an average age of 40, and are married with three children each. They mostly live in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, in Sikasso, the third largest administrative region of Mali. They are on their first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of boosting their business activities. The women sell various items, such as condiments, firewood and cereals, such as rice, with Machitan B.. Machitan B. aims to use this loan to buy four 50kg bags of rice. She sources this from the Loulouni market and in the neighbouring village markets. The rice is sold for cash at the Loulouni market to a customer base made up of men and women. She envisages enerating an average monthly profit of 6,000 FCFA - a small proportion of this will be used to save for social ends and the rest re-invested in business activities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing rice

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en: Ma. Bella L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Bella owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years now. In 2005, Ma. Bella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy materials for a water tank. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hernaldo Jose

texts.es: Hernaldo José 25 años, por lo que su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado, ya que le gusta levantarse temprano para conseguir la leche, y realizar la elaboración de cuajada. Por lo que el negocio es de herencia familiar,  con mucho sacrificio ha logrado sacarlo adelante. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Sueña con engrandecer cada día su actividad.
texts.en:
Hernaldo José is twenty-five years old and sells dairy products for a living. He has been doing this work for sixteen years because he loves it. He loves getting up early in the morning to get the milk and start making the curd. He inherited his business from his family and has had to work hard to build it up. The loan he is taking out is buy raw materials for his business. He dreams of growing his business everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maira Elieth

texts.es:
la sra. Maira Elieth L. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y nacatamales actividad que viene realizando por mas de 5 años.
Su producto lo vende de forma domiciliar y en diferentes negocios de la localidad, su producto solo es de estregar en los negocios ya que son clientes fijos que siempre le compran todo el año, es madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en la escuela publica de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en el Paraíso en una carnicería y de esta forman se apoyan mutuamente para poder salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellos y de sus hijos satisfaciendo las necesidades básicas como ser educación, alimentación, vivienda y vestuario.     
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar sus panes y sus tamales.
y según algunos vecinos Maira es una persona de muy buena conducta y cumplida con los compromisos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maira Elieth L. has been making and selling bread and nacatamales (steamed corn cakes) for five years. She sells these items from her house, and she also delivers them to different local businesses which have been steady customers throughout the years. Maira has two children, one of whom is a student at the local school. Her husband works in a butcher’s store in El Paraíso, and together they work hard to get ahead in life and improve the family’s standard of living. They have to buy basic necessities such as education, food, housing, and clothing. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients for the bread and tamales. Maira’s neighbours say that she is a good citizen and keeps her promises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Koffitsè Akuto

texts.fr: A. koffitsè est un homme très dynamique, en 2008,il s’est lancé dans le commerce de produits d’alimention générale qui est un commerce très souvent exercé par les femmes. Il attire beaucoup de clients car il a une manière très conviviale de les acceuillir. Pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients il doit se réapprovisionner c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit afin de s’acheter 4 cartons de tomates, 4 sacs de riz, 4 cartons de spaghetti, 4 bidons d’huile d’arachide.  Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en:
Koffitsé A. is a very dynamic man, in 2008, he took up the commerce of food products which is a business often performed by women. He attracts many customers because he has a very friendly way of welcoming them. To satisfy the demand of his clientele he needs to renew his stock which is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy 4 boxes of tomatoes,4 sacks of rice,4 boxes of spaghetti and 4 cans of peanut oil. His clients come from all circumstances.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of everyday food products

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene su actividad económica que es la venta y elaboración de comida por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su negocio, este no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se encuentra muy contenta por lo que han sido gratificantes. Por lo que su inicio los realiza desde 14 años, por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos. Ella se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y realizar sus deliciosos platillos. El financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, verduras, jugos, gaseosas y frutas. El sueño de Ruth es tener un lugar propio para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Ruth prepares and sells food and is always looking for ways to generate more income through her business. This is not the first time she has received a loan. Ruth is happy that the financing has helped make her work rewarding. When she started her business 14 years ago, she did not have a stable job for generating income. She now wakes up early to complete her household chores before making her delicious dishes.

This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, vegetables, juices, sodas, and fruits. Her dream is to have a place of her own where she can offer her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, vegetables, juices, sodas, and fruits

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío La Coruña, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola dedicado principalmente al cultivo D. frutas, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desD. que era muy joven, como la mayor parte D. agricultores D. la zona se dedica a la siembra D. arboles frutales, ella siembra limón en una pequeña parcela D. terreno y cuando lo cosecha los ofrece en venta a las diversas plantas procesadoras D. la zona, las cuales manufacturan sus productos para luego exportarlos al extrajero. Esta es una fuente importante D. ingresos para su familia. Adicionalmente cría y venD. animales menores como cerdos, patos y pavos.

Norma desea realizar actividades D. mantenimiento D. su cultivo D. limón para asegurarse una buena producción, por ello ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. fertilizantes, D. modo que pueda lograr su objetivo.

Norma es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad D. tener algun tipo D. estudo superior.
texts.en:
Norma is 53 years of age. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the La Coruña settlement , a rural zone that belongs to the district of TambogranD., which is an agricultural district dedicated chiefly to the cultivation of fruit which belongs to the province of Piura and is located in the region of the same name, over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been dedicated to agriculture since she was very young, Like most of the farmers of the zone, she is dedicated to sowing fruit-bearing trees. She sows lemon in a small plot of land. When she harvests it, she offers them for sale to the various food processing plants of the zone, which manufacture their products in order to export them to foreign countries. This is an important source of income for their family. Additionally she raises and sells animals such as hogs, ducks and turkeys. Norma wants to maintain her lemon orchard to be assured of good production. Because of this she has requested a loan of 1200 new soles from Edpyme Alternative for the first time that she plans to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, so that she can achieve her objective. Norm is a hard-working woman who always gives the best of herself to move her family ahead. Her greatest dream is is to continue working to offer her children the opportunity of having some type of higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her lemon crop

loans.name: Ulaula

texts.en:
Ulaula G. is 36 and married with four children (ages 2 - 8).  She owns a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ulaula has three years of experience in this business.  Ulaula  needs a loan of WST $2,900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Ulaula  joined SPBD.  This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ulaula's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta vive en la casa de sus padres y su mayor sueño es construir su casa propia, Roberta es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que estudia, Roberta viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras, papa, cereales, reparte a diferentes negocios, se queda 4 días en la Selva de donde compra frutas que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles y durante este tiempo aprendió a ser puntual, Roberta solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de papa y verduras. Roberta tiene proyectado comprar un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Roberta lives in a house with her parents. Her dream is to build a house of her own. Roberta is single and has one child who is in school. Roberta travels to the Ayacuchana jungle in order to sell vegetables, potatoes and grains. She also has other businesses. She stays in the jungle for four days in order to buy fruit there that she sells in the supply market in the city. Roberta is a member of the Los Laureles Community Bank and as a member she has learned to be punctual. Roberta is asking for a loan for 1,000 soles in order to buy potatoes and vegetables. Roberta is planning on buying a stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Antony Gitahi

texts.en: Antony, 26 years old, has been selling clothes in Naivasha since 2007. He wants to expand his business and, while looking for money to boost his business, a friend introduced him to KADET LTD. This will be his first loan and he plans to use it to buy shoes to add as stock in his shop. In the future, he plans to stock school uniforms, children's clothes, and shoes, making his shop a one-stop clothing shop.

loans.use: To add shoes to his stock

loans.name: May

texts.en: May O. is 29 years old and married to Alfie O., a fisherman. The couple are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 3. Her eldest is now a grade 5 pupil. For almost 8 years their primary source of income has been fishing. Their business is a partnership between husband and wife; he does the fishing while she sells the catch in the market. Profit from their business helps a lot in meeting their daily financial needs. However, they want to earn more and save for the future of their two children. They wish to provide them a better quality of living and send them to a prominent school. May is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to invest in setting up more fish cages. They will buy fish fingerlings, fishing nets, and bamboo poles, and pay for the labor of construction. She hopes that KIVA lenders will support her in this endeavor. She is one of the very dynamic members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner of KIVA in the Philippines.

loans.use: to invest in setting up more fish cages

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria R. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  an Avon beauty product dealership and livestock sales business. She lives in Crossing Baterna, Brgy. Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. 

Maria is now borrowing PHP 19,500 to continue funding operations of her cosmetics business. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund operation of her cosmetics sales business

loans.name: Otilda Marta

texts.es: Doña Otilia, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, de oficios domésticos,  tiene  3 hijos de los cuales 1 va a la escuela, ella cursó el sexto grado de educación primaria, es una persona que se dedica a la artesanía (tejeduría), se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 2 años, quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo y poder competir en su negocio para que pueda de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y también su condición de vida.
texts.en: Doña Otilia, 47, is married and has 3 children. She left school after the sixth grade. She has operated a business making and selling woven crafts for 2 years.  She wants to increase her working capital to make her business more competitive. Her goal is to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “ALFA Y OMEGA” inicia su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son diferentes: producción y venta de zapatos, venta y producción de mantas a crochet, venta de muebles, artesanía en alfombras, costura en artesanía en sombreros, venta de verduras, ferretería, comerciante de carne, artesanía en alfombras. Estas señoras tienen dentro de la mesa directiva a la tesorera que vela por que todas las transacciones financieras del grupo estén en orden, haciendo cumplir su reglamento interno.

 La señora tesorera de la banca comunal, la señora SaturN., este es su segundo ciclo,   que forma parte del B.C. “Alfa y Omega”.  La señora SaturN. produce y vende zapatos desde hace 6 años, al mismo que teje mantas.  Su crédito actual de Bs. 2000.- es para la compra de material, para la elaboración del calzado.
Generalmente sus ventas son realizadas en la “Ceja” de 7 de la mañana a 12 del medio día.
texts.en:
The "ALFA Y OMEGA" loan group begins its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch focal centre. This is a new group which has been fomed to receive credit, training and healthcare services. It has nine members that work in several activities: making and selling shoes, making and selling crochet blankets, selling furniture, making carpets, making hats, selling vegetables, owning a hardware store, selling meat and making carpets. The treasurer, who sits on the group board, ensures that all financial transactions are in order and enforces the internal rules of the group.

The treasurer of the "Alfa Omega" loan group is SaturN., who is on her second cycle. She has been making and selling shoes for 6 years, and she also weaves blankets. The loan of 2,000 bolivares is for the purchase of material to make footwear with. She usually sells her products at La Ceja, from 7 in the morning to 12 noon.

loans.use: Buy material to make footwear and blankets with.

loans.name: Angel Pablo

texts.es:
Angel es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el pueblo joven San Martín una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como chofer en una combi que cubre las rutas Chiclayo – Lambayeque y viceversa desde hace 20 años. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de sustento durante todo este tiempo y con ella ha sacado adelante a su familia. Su rutina empieza desde las 5 am y termina a las 10pm.

Angel desea realizar algunas reparaciones en el vehículo que utiliza para ganarse el sustento, ya que este ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Angel es una persona alegre, carismática y muy trabajadora. El ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva brindado por Edpyme Alternativa a través de su producto Capital Semilla, con este crédito el realizó algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido con cada uno de los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayudaron a realizar esta acción.
texts.en:
Angel is 57-year-old father who lives with his wife and three children in the town of San Martin, an new urban zone outside of the Lambayque distribution and 20 minutes form the city of Chiclayo.  

For twenty years, he has worked as a van chauffer that covers the Chiclayo – Lambayeque routes and back.  This business has been his primary source of support over the years, and as a result he has been able to give his family a good start in life.  His routine begins at 5am and ends at 10pm.  

Angel wants to make some repairs on his vehicle since it has begun to have some problems.  Therefore, he has asked Edpyme Alternative for a $550 loan to achieve his goal. 

Angel is a happy, charismatic person and a very hard worker.  He previously had a loan financed by Kiva and provided by Edpyme Alternativa through Capital Semilla.  With this loan he made some improvements on his home.  He is very grateful for each of the loans from Kiva that help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To repair vehicle.

loans.name: Gladys Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
La señora Gladys esta en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y está muy contenta ya que gracias  a los créditos a logrado sacar a su negocio y a su familia adelante. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de cinco años la misma que está en el primer año de escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un taxi que es de su propiedad. Ella estudio en la universidad y obtuvo el título de licenciada en ciencias de la educación. Además hace muchos años también aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa todo tipo pero dice que le encanta hacer ropa para niños, trabaja a base de pedidos, confecciona además uniformes para escuelas e instituciones. Nos dice que lleva ya con su taller por cinco años.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Ave Fénix' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Gladys has been a member of her community bank for 4 loan cycles and she is very happy because, thanks to the loans, she has managed to make progress in her business and get her family ahead.  Gladys is 41 years old.  She is married and has a 5 year-old daughter who is in her first year at school.  Her husband is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi.  Gladys studied at university and has a degree in education sciences.  She also learned dressmaking many years ago.

Gladys has a small sewing workshop where she has been sewing all kinds of clothes for many years.  She says that she most enjoys making children's clothes.  She works on orders and also makes uniforms for schools and institutions.  She tells us that she has had her workshop for five years.

This loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and other material for her dressmaking.  Her dreams are to continue working and to remain in good health.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo M. R. y la señora Elisa Cotjiri Saca son casados desde hace 5 años tiene tres rijos de 10,8, y 7 los cuales mantienen con mucho esfuerzo ya que la situación es difícil viven en la zona de la villa Primero de mayo desde hace 10 años, el señor se dedica al servicio del transporte de pasajeros en su propio taxi que pudo comprar de segunda mano para poder sustentar a su familia, la señora se dedica a vender bolsones y mochilas  es una vendedora ambulante en el mercado los pozos ya que ella no se puede comprar un puesto porque lo que ella gana solo le alcanza solo para los gastos de alimentación ya se dedican a esta actividad desde hace 3 años de un tiempo a esta parte el vehículo del Sr. Osvaldo  se ha descompuesto y como es su única fuente de ingresos  del señor, ya que la esposa lo que gana es para  la alimentación.

El préstamo o ayuda que solicita el Sr. Osvaldo es para poder reparar su vehículo y asi poder mantener a su familia con dignidad y asi poder mejorar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Osvaldo M. R. and Elisa Cotjiri Saca have been married for five years.  They have three children, ages 10, 8 and 7, whom they support with great effort since their situation is difficult.

For 10 years they have lived near the town Primero de Mayo.  Osvaldo transports passengers in his own taxi, which he bought secondhand so he could support his family. Elisa sells bags and backpacks.  She is a traveling saleswoman at the Los Pozos market.  She cannot buy a stall because she only earns enough to cover the cost of food.  She has been doing this work for three years.

Osvaldo's vehicle has broken down, and as it is his only source of income, all his wife's earnings must go toward food.

Osvaldo is asking for the loan so he can repair his vehicle and support his family with dignity.  In this way he will be able to make his children's future better.

loans.use: Payment for car repairs

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en:
Simplicio V. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 41 years old. Simplicio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Simplicio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Simplicio has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Simplicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simplicio is requesting a oan of 21000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Simplicio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar S. lives in Prey Veaeng village in Takeo province and she was born in 1967. She is a  farmer who owns a piece of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sovanna Ret Heng, is a military policeman who can only earn a low salary to support his family. Through these activities, they support three children, one of whom is a waiter, while another one is employed in a hotel, and the third is a student. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Sar S. is seeking a loan to buy ten piglets and pig feed for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets and pig feed for breeding

loans.name: Marie Gloriose

texts.en: Gloriose is 28 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children attends school. Gloriose sells clothes, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a businessman. Gloriose will use this loan to purchase more clothes and increase the quantity of what she has been selling.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Gloriose wishes to buy a house. She dreams to have a house which will be used as a source of income through renting that house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.es: Doña Juana Virginia M. T., es casada, tiene 25 años de edad, se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de tejidos, lo cual lleva 4 años con este trabajo, esmpezo siendo operaria, y actualmente realiza este trabajo en su casa de habitacion. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es piloto, solicita un prestamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo y ampliar l volumen de la produccion en el trabajo que realiza, quiere ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Virginia M. T. is married.  She’s 25 years old and works making all kinds of knits.  She’s been in this business for four years; she started out as an employee but now works from home.  Her husband, whose a pilot, supports her efforts.

She is asking for a loan to use as working capital to expand the volume of her production; she wants to see her business be large.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Ubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Francine N.  est une  commerçante âgée de 22ans qui habite en Commune Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce du sorgho qui sert a la production de la bière locale. Elle a commence ce métier depuis bientôt 2 ans. Elle  est mariée a Thiery D., un cultivateur, et ont ensemble 2 enfants de petit âge (3ans et 1an 8mois) : un garçon et une fillette 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant de  grandes quantités du sorgho  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle a une préférence particulière pour le crédit Turame-Kiva du fait que les remboursements se font en tranches mais aussi avec un taux d’intérêt accessible pour les petits commerçants.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Ubumwe II»
texts.en:
Francine N. is a 22-year old merchant who lives in the town of Rugombo, Cibitoke Province, in western Burundi. She runs a business selling sorghum, which is used to produce local beer. She begin this business almost 2 years ago. She is married to Thiery D., a farmer, and together they have 2 young children (3 years old and 1 year 8 months old): a boy and a girl.

She is seeking this loan through Kiva to increase her capital by buying large quantities of sorghum for resale in order to realize large profits. She particularly prefers loans through Turame and Kiva because the repayments are staggered and also because the interest rates are accessible to small retailers.

She is a member of the community group "Ubumwe II."

loans.use: To increase her capital by buying large quantities of sorghum for resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos aún dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Desde hace dos años, gana la vida trabajando como empleado en una empresa que produce productos de belleza y salud. Este trabajo lo ayuda solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, desea invertir en la educación de sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar el nivel de educación que sus hijos reciben para que ellos puedan obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Este préstamo permitirá que Alfredo trabaje más tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en sacar adelante a su familia. Alfredo es muy trabajador y es un padre bastante entregado a su familia. Posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 53 years old, married and has 3 dependent children. He lives together with his family in their own home in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with a lot of commercial activity that is located in the province of Lambayeque, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

For two years he has earned a living working as an employee at a business that produces beauty and health products. This work has helped him to pay for his family's expenses. Currently, he wants to invest in the education of his children. His greatest desire is to improve the level of education that his children receive, so that they can have better opportunities in the future. For this reason he has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa to pay for the school costs of his children. The loan will allow Alfredo to work more peacefully without having to return to the informal lenders that charge high interest rates, which puts his daily cash flow in jeopardy. He is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their support in helping his family to get ahead. Alfredo is very hard working and is a very involved father. He has very good personal and professional references from his rural community.

loans.use: to pay school costs for his children

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep T. N., 33 years old with two children, is living  in Xuan Trach commune. Being a farmer, her main activities are focused on growing rice in a paddy of 4800 square meters  and raising laying chickens. These agricultural products are partly used by her family for food and the rest sold for daily income.  Attending  our program since 2006, Hiep has used past loans to expand her rice and egg laying business and has more money to send to her saving account.  She is requesting for  a loan of   6,322,000 VND to buy fertilizer and feed for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for her laying chickens..

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a resident and a farmer in Kitale area, Western Kenya. He is married with four children between 5 and 14 years old, and has been in farming for eight years producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables to the local market. He is also running a motorcycle transport business for additional income.

Benjamin has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes the cow will improve his milk production and help in the repayment of the loan, and eventually add an asset to the family, eventually uplifting the family living standards. He is optimistic with the business and plans to have five better breed cows in five years.

Benjamin says the cost of artificial insemination are still to high for farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase noodles, salt, sugar and fish sauce to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is a 47-year-old man who provides the motor taxi service to people who need to go anywhere in and around Kompong Cham Province. He has over 10 years' experience in this occupation and frequently earns around $1.50 each day to support his family with financial expenses. 

In order to contribute to their income, Heng’s wife works in a farm field planting a crop twice per year. They have four children who live under the roof with them. One of their children works in a garment factory as a sewing worker. Heng will be using his loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one which often breaks down.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one which often breaks down.

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.es: María Esmeralda de 33 años de edad, reside en su casa con sus dos hijas de 12 y 7 años de edad, ambas se encuentran estudiando. María se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Tiene un pequeño negocio en su hogar de residencia en el cual cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para preparar los ingrediente y tener  listas las deliciosas tortillas que por su dedicación e higiene le demandan con mucha frecuencia. Para María lo mas importantes son sus hijas y no pierde la esperanza que algún día las verá convertidas en grandes profesionales.  Esto es lo que le da fuerza para seguir trabajando día a día. Además ha sabido ganarse la confianza de todos sus vecinos los cuales cada día le demandan más tortillas. María es  una mujer arriesgada y trabajadora por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria como maíz, agua, gas propano, etc. Con el objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Esmeralda is 33 years old. She lives in a house with her two children, ages 12 and 17. Both her children are in school. Maria sells tortillas. She has a small business in her home. Every morning she gets up early in order to prepare the ingredients for her product. She prepares delicious tortillas that are frequently in demand as she is a dedicated and hygienic worker. The most important people for Maria are her children. She will not lose hope that one day they will have great professions. This is what gives Maria the motivation to work each day. She has also gained the respect of all of her neighbors, who each day request more tortillas. Maria is a hardworking and adventuresome woman. This is why she is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL. With this loan she will buy the basic ingredients needed to make tortillas such as corn, water, propane, etc. With these supplies she will be able to meet her customer’s requests, which will increase her earnings and therefore increase the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy the necessary raw materials such as corn, water, propane, etc.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single, and lives with two family members.

Raed has had a food market since 2007 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a ceiling for his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a ceiling for his market and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.ru:
Меружан родился в 1974 г. в городе Капане, в данный момент проживает в селе Нижний Хотанан. Он пока не женат и проживает один. 
Более 1о лет Меружан занимается сельким хозяйством: разводит крупный рогатый скот. Полученную сельскохозяйсвенную продукцию (говяжье мясо и молоко) он продает перекупщикам, которые продают ее на рынке города Капана. 
Меружану необходим кредит на сумму 730.000 драм для организации работ по уборке сена, т.е для приобретения топлива для трактора и веревки для перевязки сена, для аренды самого трактора и для осуществления выплаты трактористу за проделанную работу.
texts.en: Meruzhan was born in 1974 in Kapan and currently lives in Lower Hotanan village. He's not married and lives alone. For more than ten years, Meruzhan has run a small farm, where he breeds large cattle. Middlemen buy his produce (beef and milk) to sell at Kapan's market. Meruzhan's asking for a loan of 730,000 drams to organize a haymaking process. He must rent a tractor, obtain fuel, pay a tractor operator's salary and purchase rope to bind hay.

loans.use: To organize a haymaking process

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley was born in 1981. He is a focused and hardworking businessman. He is single. Since the year 2000, he has been operating a boutique to make ends meet. Over the next five years, he wants to have penetrated and invested in other sectors of the economy. His dream is to be a real estate mogul.
He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy clothes, shoes and mattresses for resale. He is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for giving him access to credit facilities.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with one family member who works.

He has owned a barber shop since 2006. He has good experience and he has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Martha Segunda

texts.es: Martha de 46 años es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 22 a 30 años y se dedica en el municipio de Soledad, donde vive,  a la confección de cortinas abullonados, cenefas y cojines, actividad que aprendió hace 30 años para apoyar la gestión de su hogar; ella inicialmente trabajó en un taller de muebles, donde cosía a mano y posteriormente adquirió una nueva experiencia en un almacén de costura de cortinas durante 13 años, hasta que en el año 1990, con el producto de su liquidación, comprara una maquina e iniciara su propia aventura de negocio y hasta la presente ha logrado ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Martha tiene un año de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que la ha apoyado con capital de crédito por eso su capital se ha incrementado y en la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, segundo financiamiento con esta organización, el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales para rellenos, telas correderas y otros insumos además de un máquina familiar, que facilite el incremento de su producción y con ello sus ventas.  Su meta es incrementar la clientela y ofrecer oportunidades de ingresos a más operarias. Mientras esto ocurre se esmera en su trabajo manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 16% desde la cual planea su incremento.
texts.en:
Martha is 46 and the mother of 3 children who range in age from 22 to 30.  She works in the municipality of Soledad, where she also lives.  She makes curtains, valances, and cushions, an activity that she learned 30 years ago to support her home.  She initially worked in a furniture shop where she sewed by hand and later acquired new experience in a sewing shop making curtains for 13 years.  In 1990, the shop was liquidated, and she bought a sewing machine and started her own business.  She has obtained good income to support her family's well-being.

Martha has worked with Fundación Santo Domingo for one year.  They have supported her with capital through a loan, and she is now applying for her second loan, which she will invest in the purchase of materials like padding, cords, and other supplies as well as a family sewing machine that will facilitate an increase in her production, and with it, her sales.  Her goal is to grow her clientele and to offer income opportunities to more workers.  She works very hard and maintains a profitability of no less than 16%, which is why she is planning her growth.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials like stuffing, fabric, cords, and other materials, as well as a family sewing machine.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Joshua has been operating a barber shop in Makueni town. He is 52 years old and married to Annastacia .They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. He paid his other loans well and in good time. He intends to use this loan to purchase a motorbike as he ventures into the transport business to generate more income inn addition to his barber shop.

In the future Joshua hopes to practice greenhouse farming.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Emilba Rosa

texts.es:
Emilia y su negocio se caracteriza por tener una excelente calidad y servicio, ella ofrece a sus clientes comidas rápidas en un carrito ubicada en las calles. Ella con su negocio ayuda a su familia confirmada por sus 5 hijos y su esposo a tener una buena calidad de vida.

Ella se sueña poder tener un restaurante para así poderle dejar a sus hijos una buen negocio para que ellos puedan sostenerse económicamente cuando ella y su esposo falten.
texts.en:
Emilia and her business are known for their excellent quality and service.  She sells fast food from a small stand in the street.  Through her work she is able to provide a quality lifestyle to her family of five children and husband.

Her dream is to have a restaurant one day so she can leave a good business to her children and they can support themselves when she and her husband are no longer around.

loans.use: To buy a cooking stove.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a Palestinian young man, who is married and has two sons and one daughter. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has a project of raising birds for sale.
 
Ali has a store for selling air conditioners and spare parts. He wants to purchase more air conditioners and spare parts, as he prepares to open a second branch of his store.  He would like to have a variety of items for sale in order to increase his income. He does not have enough to pay for the additional items, so he needs to complete the amount with a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Ali gets the loan, he will have a better collection and will have the ability to open the second store branch. In this way, he will increase his income and improve his family life. Ali is photographed next to his store.

loans.use: to purchase more air conditioners and spare parts for air conditioners.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is an embroidery expert and does decorative embroidery for her community clients. She also sells clothes to them which she purchases from different cities. 

She is married and her husband is an animal seller. He has some animals like buffaloes and goats which he sells after raising them to butchers and also sells their milk to his community clients. 

Bashiraan is the mother of an 18-year-old daughter who is studying in intermediate and also learning embroidery from her mother. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy some animals for improving his business.  

He has been operating his business for the past six years and Bashiraan is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business that will help her family to improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy animals for her husband's animal sales business.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Более трех лет Диловар занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Он покупает скот из местных рынках, затем откармливает их в течении определенный период а потом продает на выгодную цену. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит хороший прибыль. Диловар хотел бы получит займ в размере 1250$ США для покупки крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Dilovar is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Dilovar has been involved in fattening up cattle for over three years.  He buys livestock from local markets, then fattens it up over a set period of time and then sells it at a profitable price.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Dilovar wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1250 for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sibumba A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sibumba A Group in Western Kenya! Julius is the facilitator of Sibumba group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Julius takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Julius had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julius was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julius  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Julius will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sibumba A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor integrante del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de verduras, huevos, condimentos, carbón, entre otros, en un puesto que tiene ubicado en una feria libre. Ahí trabaja todos los días de la semana en un horario de 10ºº a 19ºº horas.
Se dedica a éste negocio desde hace tres años, comenta que le ha ido muy bien y que su clientela va en expansión.
Su mercadería la compra cada 15 días, en diferentes comercios, donde los precios sean convenientes económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará yerbas, condimentos y papas, para abastecer su negocio. 
Las metas para su negocio son habilitar un local en su casa y abastecerlo con mercadería, de esta manera sería más cómodo para ella.  
Leonor vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños a nivel personal son comprar una camioneta que le permita trasladar su mercadería, ya que actualmente debe pagar fletes (alquiler de un medio de transporte para trasladar mercadería) todos los días de la semana. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta que disfruta de las reuniones del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que los integrantes son muy unidos, responsables, en definitiva dice que es un excelente grupo.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido a distribuir sus ingresos y gastos de mejor manera, lo que le ha permitido mantener su negocio organizado. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Leonor, a member of the communal bank "Fuerza de Mujer," lives in the city of Temuco.  She works in retail trade, specifically, selling vegetables, eggs, condiments, coal, and other items in a stall located in a free market.  There she works each day of the week from 10am until 7pm.  

She has had this business for 3 years, and she comments that it is going very well and that her customer base is expanding. 

Leonor buys her merchandise every 15 days from different businesses, where the prices are most appealing.  With this loan she will buy herbs, condiments and potatoes to restock her store.

Her goals are to set up a place in her home for her business and to stock it with merchandise.  In this way, she would be more comfortable.   Leonor lives with her husband and one of her dreams at the personal level is to buy a van that would allow her to transport her merchandise, since now she has to pay freight charges (to rent some means of transport to move her merchandise) every day of the week.

Leonor is very happy and grateful for this opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is providing her to invest in her business.  In addition, she comments that she enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, since the members of her group are very united and responsible.  She says it's definitely a great group.

Through the training provided in the meetings, Leonor has learned how to distribute her earnings and expenses in a better way, which has allowed her to keep her business better organized.  Temuco is the capital of the La Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile.)  In the surrounding areas, there are a number of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica), and very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks. It’s worth pointing out that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous peoples of our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy herbs, condiments and potatoes to stock up her store

loans.name: Waiswa

texts.en:
Waiswa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past six years, Waiswa has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells women's clothes.

To help expand his business, Waiswa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dresses, blouses, and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomesi, and will help Waiswa to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Waiswa hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children to higher levels. 

Waiswa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Waiswa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more dresses, blouses, and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomesi.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
This is Helen, who is 52 years old and from Machipisa, Zimbabwe. A widow with five children, she also cares for her aging mother. 

Helen runs a manufacturing business, making freezits (frozen soft drinks) and also selling kitchen ware. The business has been in operation for two years. Helen says the main challenges she faces are lack of capital and power disruptions, as well as storage of her wares. 

Helen has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy raw materials for making freezits. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Helen plans to have industrial machinery and own a freezit wholesale company.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make freezits (frozen soft drinks).

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 26 years old and married to Patrick. They have two children.

She has been selling used clothing for the last 4 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 28,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 50,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the profits to open up another second-hand clothing shop and to pay for school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Odalis

texts.es:
Odalis, tiene 42 años de edad es una mujer alegre, entusiasta  y emprendedora. Convive con Alfonso quien es comerciante. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo que es discapacitado. El trabajo que realiza Odalis, es la crianza de pollos, ésta crianza lo realiza en su propio terreno, donde tiene instalado un galpón con una capacidad de hasta 200 pollos, ésta actividad viene realizando desde hace 03 años consecutivos, tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida por los vecinos y compradores  mayoristas que le compran los pollos. Ésta actividad lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos ya sea para la crianza, limpieza y venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es rentable, le da un buen ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus gastos, y le permite estar en todo momento con sus hijos. Lo que no le gusta es que los alimentos del pollo varían en el precio, lo cual hacen variar sus márgenes de ganancia, pero  esto no la desanima a seguir trabajando. Nos comenta que tiene planes de criar mayor cantidad de pollos porque así obtendrá mayor ingreso económico. Este será su 04 préstamo con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables, espera poder seguir bien y seguir trabajando con la institución a quien agradece mucho por la oportunidad brindada.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 3000 nuevos  soles comprará hojas de bijao que se utilizan para cambiar y ampliar su galpón, y así poner más cantidad de pollos.
texts.en:
Odalis is 42 years old and a cheerful, enthusiastic, and enterprising woman. She is in a common-law relationship with Alfonso, who is a merchant. They live together in their own home along with her son who is disabled. Odalis raises chickens on her own land and has a chicken coop that can hold up to 200 birds. She has been in this business for three consecutive years. During this time, she has become well-known among her neighbors and the wholesale buyers who purchase chickens. In her business, Odalis has the support of her children who help with raising, cleaning, and selling the chickens. What she enjoys about her work is the profitability because the good income that she generates allows her to pay for expenses. She also gets to spend every moment with her children. What she does not like are the cost variations in feeding the chickens because they cause her profit margins to be unstable. However, she is not discouraged from continuing her work. Odalis says that she has plans to raise chickens in larger quantities so that she can earn more income.

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP organization. She enjoys being part of her group because she feels the members are responsible. Odalis expects to continue doing well and working with the organization. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her. The loan of 3000 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy “bijao” (a South American plant) leaves to remodel and expand her chicken coop. She will also buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and "bijao" leaves for renovating her chicken coop.

loans.name: Evelyn Patricia

texts.es: Evelyn mantiene en Isla Trinitaria una venta de ropa. Tiene 31 años de edad y está casada. El negocio lo inicio gracias a una amiga que la convenció de ir a vacacionar a Panamá. En esta ciudad se dio cuenta que la ropa es bonita y económica por lo que la animo a que traiga ropa y empiece el negocio. Su horario de trabajo empieza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche pero lo realiza solo bajo pedido. No comento que de esta manera le resulta con más beneficios ya que tiene su clientela seleccionada evitando de esa manera que no le queden mal en los pagos. Su esposo Jacinto le ayuda con la venta y también en la compra de la mercadería, cuando no puede viajar ella lo realiza su esposo. Tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad y estudian en un colegio particular cerca de su domicilio. Con el préstamo va a viajar a Panamá para invertir comprando ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones etc. su sueño próximo es terminar de construir su domicilio y que sus hijos terminen su estudios hasta poderlos apoyar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Evelyn manages a clothing business in Isla Trinitaria. She is 31 years old and married. Evelyn started this business thanks to a friend who convinced her to go on a vacation in Panama. While she was there, she found beautiful and affordable clothing that she was eager to bring back with her in order to start a business. Her work schedule begins at 9am and continues until 8pm, but only if she has to complete an order. She says that it has been very beneficial for her to avoid certain customers who are delinquent with their payments. Her husband helps with making sales and also buying the merchandise whenever she is not able to travel. They have two children, ages 15 and 13, who are studying at a private high school near their home.

With this loan, Evelyn will travel to Panama so that she can buy clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers, and other items. Her next wishes are to finish the construction of her home and to see her children finish their studies through the university level.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: Doris Cecilia

texts.es: Doris de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que vive con su familia, sus hijos y su compañero de vida. Es muy responsable, honrada y amigable. Se dedica al cultivo del maíz, frijol, y sorgo, cada mañana se levanta con nuevas ilusiones y deseos de superación por ella y su familia, como vende lo que cosecha es rentable debido a la cantidad de los productos y a los precios accesibles. Doris piensa que necesita vender un poco más y es por eso que decidió acercarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y comprar insumos agrícolas como: Semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas entre otros. Doris confia en que la presente cosecha y con la ayuda recibida le irá mejor y podrá cumplir su sueño que es entregarle un mejor futuro a su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar insumos básicos como: Semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé de femmes habitant la même commune et se fréquentent les mêmes marchés hebdomadaires et sont très solidaires entre elles. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Maty est âgée de 63 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 filles et 05 garçons. 

Son prêt reçu, elle va acheter une dizaine de sacs de mil, d'arachide et de maïs qu'elle va revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle va acheter aussi 04 moutons et 03 chèvres les élever avant de revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices générés, elle va améliorer le quotidien de la famille, payer ses intérêts et renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 13, 2008.  It consists of women who live in the same locality and who go to the same weekly markets.  They are very supportive of each other.

Maty, the featured borrower, is standing on the right-hand side in the photo and raising her hand.  She is 63 years old, married, and the mother of five girls and five boys.

Having received her loan, she will buy ten bags of millet, groundnut and maize and will resell her goods at the weekly markets.  She will also buy and raise four sheep and three goats for resale.

With the profits generated thanks to her activity, she will improve the day-to-day living conditions of her family, pay off her interest and strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, groundnut and maize, and also to raise livestock.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling provisions in her village of Domenase near Elmina.  She has been involved in this enterprise for two years.  

Maame is married and has four children.  Her husband works as a farmer.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Maame wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.  In the long term, Maame plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet increasing customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify my business to include clothes

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en: K. Taiba is a 34 year old woman with two young children. Dynamic and ambitious, she has been in the fish business since she was 18. K. is the main financial resource provider for her family, as her husband recently lost his job. She wants to expand her grilled fish selling activities in order to be able to make school fee payments in October 2007 for her two children.  K. received her first loan from AE&I on December 2005 and has always reimbursed in a timely manner.

loans.use: Kablan Taiba will use loan to expand her sales of grilled fish.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana has been operating a footwear kiosk in the Melitopol, Ukraine market for over seven years. An experienced businesswoman and veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine, Tatyana has successfully utilized and repaid several loans that have helped her to develop a successful and sustainable business. With the profits from her business, Tatyana supports her family and her elderly parents. She is hardworking and reliable, having repaid all past loans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan for $500 to re-supply her inventory. With the profits, Tatyana plans to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Tatyana would like to purchase additional inventory for her footwear kiosk.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mrs. Pho M., 47, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Currently, Pho M. herself does not work, but her husband, 50, runs a small stall charging vehicle batteries. Pho M. has applied for this loan so that she can buy speakers and musical instruments to rent out to the people in her area. She believes that there is demand for this as people like to play instruments on special occasions but do not want to buy them as they are not useful enough during the year.

loans.use: to buy speakers and musical instruments to rent to the people in her area

loans.name: Marlenia

texts.es:
My name is Marlenia A., and I dedicate myself to selling general consumer goods from my grocery store. I have been in business – which I manage myself -- for several years, and am very well known locally as I have lived in this community for 35 years. I would like to further supply my store with basic market products, and since prices have gone up I could use additional funds to buy a greater variety of goods. With my earnings I can help to feed my family, as being a senior this is my only means of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

mi Nombre es Marlenia A. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace varios años el cual administro personalmente, tengo muy buena clientela y soy una persona muy conocida y querida por mis vecinos ya que tengo 35 años de vivir en esta comunidad, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que muchos productos de la canasta basica han aumentado de precio y necesito mayor capital para comprar mas variedad de productos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia ya que como soy de la tercera edad es mi unica fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell in grocery store.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah is a 45-year-old married woman. She has a small stall where she sells some foods: cakes and fried snacks. She also sells vegetables, going to various places to find customers. She can earn $10 per day and it's just enough to cover their daily needs. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.en:
