Z. Mohiniso is 45 years old. Mohiniso and her husband, a driver, have a large family. There are 7 members in their family, of whom 3 are dependents and 1 is underage.

Mohiniso sells clothes for kids in the local market. She has been running her business already for 18 years. Mohiniso tries to purchase goods of a good quality. At the same time, the prices for the goods are attractive for the population with average income. Moreover, her trading place is located in a very good place in the market. All these things help her to serve more and more clients from year to year and to make her business successful, which allows her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Mohiniso has been working with IMON already for 4 years. She was provided with several loans for expanding her business. Each time Mohiniso was very precise in the loans payments.

Now she requests $ 400.00 US Dollars in order to buy clothes for kids for the spring which comes in Tajikistan quite early in the beginning of March and sometimes late February. Mohiniso is planning to pay the loan completely in 4 months. She would like to thank everybody who made the decision to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes for kids for the season of spring

loans.name: Lourdes Maria Mine

texts.es:
Lourdes is the mother of four children: one boy and three girls, of whom only one still lives at home because she is disabled. Lourdes is divorced and, in order to avoid being a burden for her other children, she began a business selling chicken. Little by little, her customer base has grown, and her treatment and knack with customers has helped build her list of clients. Today, she would like to expand her product selection and sell fruit, vegetables, and some groceries so she may improve her sales and quality of life.

As a result, Lourdes is soliciting a credit of US $925 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Lourdes will be able to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and build an inheritance for her daughter. With your help, Lourdes can help her daughter get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Lourdes, es madre de 4 hijos un varón y 3 hijas, de las cuales ya solamente le queda una , que tiene problemas de discapacidad, es divorciada, y para no ser una carga para sus otros hijos inicio el negocio de la venta de pollos, poco a poco su clientela ha crecido, su trato y algunas facilidades con ciertos clientes ha hecho crecer su clientela, hoy día quiere ampliar su giro y vender frutas, verduras y algunos abarrotes, para así mejorar sus ventas y calidad de vida.

Es por eso que Lourdes está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Lourdes podrá comprar más mercancía para incrementar sus ventas. Y así poder formar un patrimonio para su hija. Con tu ayuda Lourdes podrá sacar a su hija adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is 40 years old and is married to a teacher. She has three children and helps support her family by selling second-hand clothing. She is requesting $525 to buy more clothes and to expand her product line. She is hoping this loan will increase her profit and she’ll be better able to provide income for her family. Janet is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of eleven members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: Janet would like to buy more clothes and to expand her product line.

loans.name: Latifa's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Latifa is 34-years-old and is married with two children, ages 21 and 11. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 60 and 52. Latifa owns a small cloth shop which she started in 2005. She works from 8AM to 5PM and has a monthly profit oft $80.

Latifa has taken out two successful loans which she used to grow her business. She is requesting her third loan to purchase more items. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, both who have beauty salon businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to expand the business

loans.name: Meylin Eliette

texts.es:
Mrs. N. has been working with our institution for eight years where she's received eleven credits. These credits were used very well and were used for her steady job. She used to sell chicken, eggs from home. With the credit she was able to purchase a pick-up truck which she currently shares with her husband. They go out and sell on the streets and also sell some items from home. The client is married, has two kids which she supports. Their oldest son oversees the house while the parents go out to sell in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora N. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace ocho años donde ha manejado once creditos los que han sidi dirijidos a capital de trabajo y activo fijo, anteriormente su negocio era en su casa donde ella vendia pollo, huevos y otros con uno de los creditos otorgados compro una pequeña camioneta en la hoy en dí en compañia de su esposo salen a vender de forma ambulante y mantiene en su casa la venta igual que antes, La cliente esta casada y tiene dos hijos los que tambien apoyan el negocio ya que el hijo mayor es quien ve el negocio en la casa mienstras sus padres estan vendiendo fuera.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, eggs, cookies/crackers, sweets etc.

loans.name: Alicia Concepción

texts.es:
Señora Alicia is 33-years old; lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood; is married; and has three children who are 12, 14, and 16. Her husband is a baker and helps with the family's expenses.

Doña Alicia is a pastry maker and cake decorator. She has 8 years of experience and started as an assistant. Now she works on her own.

With the money that you might loan her, she is going to make improvements to her home by constructing a room. One of her wishes is to be able to finish her house, and she hopes to be able to do it with future loans. The next one would go towards constructing a room for each one of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Alicia tiene 33 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, y tiene tres hijos de 12,14 y 16 años de edad, su esposo es panificador y ayuda a los gastos de la familia.

Doña Alicia es decoradora de repostería y queque, tiene ocho años de experiencia e inició como ayudante, ahora trabaja por cuenta propia.

Con el dinero que le presten va hacer mejoras a su vivienda en la construcción de un cuarto. Unos de sus deseos es poder terminar de construir su casa, y espera poder hacerlo con préstamos futuros. Lo siguiente será poder hacer un cuarto de habitación para cada uno de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase materials to construct a room

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 59 years old, her husband Jose is 57 years old, and they have two grown sons who are professionals. They have been working in their trade for more than 30 years, and have a lovely dispensary (small store) in their house, from which they maintain a large influx of clients, thanks to their kindness and good care.

Celestina was born to be a businesswoman because ever since she was a young girl, she has shown the enterprising spirit, and through the years she has understood how to maintain the business so that today it is one of the busiest in the area. Moreover, it gave her the possibility that her sons would be able to study and become professionals. This has been a source of great pride and personal achievement.

With this loan, she will buy meat, noodles, and sugar.

loans.use: With this loan, she will buy meat, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina O. is married with two grown kids. She is from Stry where she runs a business selling women’s outer wear and school uniforms in the local market. Galina has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, she has about $2400 in merchandise and about $3000 of gross income.

Galina is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase 30 school uniforms before the upcoming school year. Her vending facility need to be reconstructed and all profits generated this month will be invested in this project. The current loan will not only benefit Galina’s business but will also provide a job for a hired employee working as a salesperson in her kiosk. We believe perfect credit history and determination will help Galina repay this loan on time and succeed in all her entrepreneurial endeavors.

Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase 30 school uniforms

loans.name: Inon

texts.id: Pinjaman senilai Rp.1.000.000 yang sebelumnya Inon terima telah dipakai untuk menambah isi warung minumannya. Saat ini, selain menjual minuman kemasan seperti Fanta dan Cocacola, dia juga sudah bisa menjual aneka jus buah di warungnya. Pinjaman periode pertama dipakai untuk membeli buah dan alat untuk membuat jus (blender). Setiap hari dia belanja buah-buahan di Pasar Anyar Sari dengan diantar oleh suaminya Jhony. Selain menjadi minuman kesukaan masyarakat sekitar, Inon juga merasa beruntung karena tempat dia berjualan minuman dan jus buah tepat bersebelahan dengan warung makan. Setiap minggunya, dia bisa mendapat keuntungan bersih Rp.200.000, tergantung banyaknya pelanggan. Inon berharap, setelah dia melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama dengan baik, kali ini dia bisa diberi modal lagi untuk mendukung usaha jual minumannya.
texts.en:
Initial loan of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00) that Inon received earlier has been used to increase inventory of her Drink stall. This time besides selling sodas like Fanta & Coca Cola, she has also been able to sell Fruit juice in her stall. First period loan was used to buy fruits and a blender. Every day she shops for fruits at Anyar Sari market, driven by her husband Jhony. Besides being the favorite drink of surrounding area, Inon feels lucky since the place she sells drinks and juice is next to a food stall. Every sunday, she could have a nett profit of approximately Rp 200,000, depending on the number of customers. Inon hopes that after finishing her first loan well, she would be given additional capital to support her drinks business.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Nadège

texts.fr: Madame Nadège P. est née à Lomé le 29/01/1977. Commerçante, elle vit avec son  mari et leur quatre 04 enfants. Ils habitent le quartier Kégué. Elle est spécialisée dans le commerce de pagnes et la confection et  vente de trousseaux pour bébés. Elle sollicite ce  crédit pour faire une commande de pagnes et de tissus pour trousseaux  bébés dans le cadre  d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nadège P. was born in Lome on January 29, 1977. She is a shopkeeper and lives with her husband and their 4 children. They live in the neighborhood of Kégué. Her specialty is the retail of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric) and the making and sale of baby clothing. She is requesting this loan to make an order of pagnes and fabric to make baby clothes in order to increase her revenue and to meet her customers' demand.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric) and sale of homemade baby clothes

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en: Ramzan baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and holy places. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. None of her children goes to school. She owes a six-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. Ramzan baji’s husband has a plastic-bag-selling business. He buys bags from a scrap shop and sells to different factories. The factories melt the bags and make plastic utensils (pots, dinner sets). He has been in this business for the last 7 years. Ramzan baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. Ramzan baji is applying for a loan to buy more plastic bags to resell.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bags to resell

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. T. is 51 years old and lives in the Nghe An Province, in Vietnam. She has four children, all of them of adult age. She has been in TYM since 2004. Her income comes from tailoring and selling cloth. Since she joined TYM, she has always repaid her loans on time.

For the next loan cycle, Mrs. T. wants to borrow $1000 to buy more materials for her tailor shop.

loans.use: Purchase more material for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Mario Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Mario Marcelino R. en conjunto con sus dos hermanos Omar y Mario, se dedica a la actividad  de carpintería habiendo adquirido la habilidad desde muy jovencito y habiéndose dedicado a este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

El señor Mario Marcelino es padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en su obligación por lo que tiene que darles de comer y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios. 

El propósito por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de madera y materiales de trabajo para continuar en la actividad de la carpintería.
texts.en:
Mario Marcelino R., together with his two brothers Omar and Mario, works in carpentry, having acquired the skill when he was very small, having dedicated himself to the business, with much effort and devotion in the town of Managua, specifically in the municipality of Cuidad Sandino. Mario Marcelino is the father of four sons of which two are still dependent on him to provide food and the necessary conditions for them to study. His ambition in approaching Ceprodel is to obtain a credit which will allow him to purchase wood and work materials to continue his carpentry business.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood for his business

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Madame   Haoua T. a 59 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six (6) enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Haoua T. n‘ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école , elle s’interesa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des  friperies il y a maintenant plus de vingt (20) ans. Elle mène son activité de façon ambulante à Sikasso où elle a une grande réputation et une notoriété hors paire. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq (5) ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association de femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 9ème prêt individuel commerçant (PIC) tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 3 balles de friperie de qualités différentes (draps, napéron, serviette, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre de services en services  au comptant et  crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et faire face aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Madam Haoua T. is 41 years old and lives in a large family with her husband and her six children (one boy and five girls) in Wayerma I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to make progress in school, she got interested 20 year ago in income-generating work, notably commerce in second-hand clothing. She goes door-to-door in Sikasso, where she has a great reputation and outstanding fame.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After six solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, with a women's assocation in her district, she is on her ninth PIC (a commercial individual loan). She intends to use this loan to buy 3 bales of different sheets, mats, napkins, etc. She buys her goods locally from wholesalers and then resells them from agency to agency, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital and to cope with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Sokharn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokharn H. is 51 years old and lives in Brasout Kor village located in Kampong Cham province. She is a beautician who does make up applications for people in wedding ceremonies and other functions. Her husband, Mr. Sim Boeun, is a carpenter who earns a small income. They have one child who is currently attending school.

Her husband wants to start a new business by purchasing an electrical generator to rent out for different functions, such as weddings and ceremonies. Thus, Mrs. Sokharn H. is asking for a loan to help her husband start his business.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina M. Castellón tiene 45 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cosméticos como pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios, perfumes, cremas y maquillaje. Doña María se ha dedicado a este negocio hace más de 11 años. Por lo que esta solicitando un financiamiento para seguir con este negocio ya que es el único medio de supervivencia para su familia. La cantidad que solicita es de C$9.800 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses y con esto podría comprar los diferentes productos. Sus sueños son de estudiar la carrera de derecho internacional para poseer más conocimientos.
texts.en:
María Delfina M. Castellón is 45 years-old -- she buys and sells beauty products such as nail polish, lipstick, perfume, cream, and make-up. She has dedicated herself to this business, which provides the only source of income for her family, for over 11 years. Maria is requesting a loan of C$ 9,800 cordobas (that she will re-pay in 12 months) to purchase various beauty products. Maria dreams of increasing her knowledge by studying international law.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase various beauty products

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
K. Marthe est née vers 1962 à Catchi dans le 2e Arrondissement de la vile de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Marthe est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants dont deux(2) scolarisés. Marthe est vendeuse de bouillie faite à base maïs et de galettes d'arachide, de farine de blé, de sucre et de fruits de coco ainsi que de jus de citron et de maïs localement appelé « adoyo ». Pour accroitre son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Marthe exprime un besoin de prêt.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
K. Marthe was born around 1962 in Catchi, in the 2nd district of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She sells cornmeal bouillie (a thin porridge) and pancakes made of flour, sugar, and coconut, as well as a beverage made from lemon juice and corn called “adoyo” locally. To grow her sales figures and her revenues, so as to provide for her family, she is expressing a need for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of flour, peanuts, and coconut

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng T., 33, has been taking a job as a domestic fruit trader for more than four years. She normally buys the fruit from a wholesale supplier and retails them to gain income. She is married with one teenage child who is attending the local school. Her husband helps feed the family by working as a farmer. They all live in Banteay Meanchey Province. T. is delighted that her investment has been growing and gaining more income. To make the business more successful, T. is looking for a loan to increase her business capital to buy additional fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional fruit to sell

loans.name: 01 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Lan H. Thị, a 54-year-old female living in Thanh Hoá, Vietnam, is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01 - Nam Ngạn (17.01.01).

Lan, who is married and has three adult children, owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the selling of dried goods in the local community. Lan has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lan has already repaid a previous loan of 2,442,600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND for additional expansion. This will be Lan’s fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Ngô Thị Ân is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. P. Thị Mạc is a 63-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 3. M. Thị Hương is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 4. Vũ Thị Hoà is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "San Francisco" esta representado por la señora Irene,  es un grupo nuevo que cuenta con 12 integrantes  las mayorías de las socias tienen experiencia porque han trabajado en anteriores grupo y se han integrado nuevas socias,  de manera que son personas con ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante. En general las socias se dedican a actividades comerciales de venta de empanadas, ropa, cosméticos y a prestar servicios de empleadas y chóferes. el destino del crédito es para empezar nuevos negocios y hacer crecer los que ya tienen obteniendo un capital para la compra de mercaderías e insumos así como herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Francisco community bank is represented by Sra. Irene. It's a new group that includes 12 members, most of whom have experience with community banking because they've been members of other groups before. There are new members, as well, and all of them want to work and get ahead. The members operate various businesses selling products such as empanadas, clothing, and cosmetics or providing services such as cleaning or public transportation. The loan will be used to start new businesses and to grow those that have already received capital, money that has been used to buy merchandise and supplies, work tools, for example, that help them to increase their incomes and, in turn, improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu H. is forty-three years old. He is married and has eight children: three sons and five daughters. They are all still in school: some are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. Aminu lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. Aminu’s wife is a trader.

Aminu is a butcher. He sells fresh meat such as beef, mutton, etc., in a shop at the market square. Most of his customers are food vendors. He buys live animals all the way from northern Ghana where the cost is economical.

Aminu has been in business for twenty-two years and wants a loan to buy more livestock. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock for his butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Nataly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nataly  vive en la zona Huayna Potosí  calle  20  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es soltera, vive junto a su pequeño sobrino del cual se hizo cargo al morir la esposa de su hermano mayor.

La señora se dedica a la venta de sombreros en una feria matinal que se realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta horas 10, en una zona céntrica de la Ciudad de la Paz. Dicha mercadería la adquiere de su abuela y su tía las cuales confeccionan dichos sombreros.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mayor mercadería y así  incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro,  y el segundo via KIVA. la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Nataly lives at calle 20 in the Huayna Potosí region of the city of El Alto.
She is single and lives with her young nephew. She began taking care of him after the death of her older brother’s wife.
She sells hats at a morning market that takes place from 6 in the morning until 10 in central La Paz. She gets her merchandise from her grandmother and aunt who make the hats.
She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to increase her production and therefore her income.
This is her third loan with Impro and her second via Kiva. An evaluation determined that she qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena G. tiene 43 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Desde muy joven ella ha trabajo para progresar en la vida. Aura tiene la actividad económica de venta de granos básicos y leña. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y además elaboraba unas deliciosas enchiladas. Pero debido a la artritis que posee tuvo que dejar de elaborar tortillas y dedicarse a venta de granos básicos y leña. Aura solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y leña. Su deseo es construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente vive con su Mama.
texts.en:
43-year old Aura Elena G. is married and is raising a son. Since she was a young woman, she has worked in order to get on in life. Aura earns her living by selling staple grains and firewood. She has been doing this work for more than twelve years; beforehand she made and sold tortillas as well as delicious enchiladas. However, because of arthritis she had to stop making tortillas and sell grains and firewood instead. She is asking for a loan to buy more products like rice, sugar, oil, and firewood. Her dream is to build her own house as at the moment she lives with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Marilli Viky

texts.es:
La señora Marilli es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 4 niños, ella tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, huevos, sal, harina, etc.

Su sueño es comprarse una casa en Arequipa. 

A ella le gustan los ahorros y  las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Marilli is a member of the Communal Bank “30 de Agosto”, which is located in the district of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and the mother of 4 children. She completed her high school education.

Sra. Marilli has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase groceries.

She currently needs another loan of 3000 soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, salt, flour, etc. Her dream is to buy a house in Arequipa. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea P., 53-years old mother of six children is a seamstress. She started her business in 2004 and until now, she is doing the same thing because she is happy doing it everyday, to sew and make beautiful dresses.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy materials, fabric and to repair the sewing machine for her to pursue her business.

She said that she likes the credit services of CEVI so much and she is willing to avail more loans in CEVI in the future.

loans.use: fabrics and sewing machine repair

loans.name: Ama  Adissou

texts.fr: A. Ama Adissou est une femme de 32 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à Lomé, une ville située à 120 kilomètres de Kpalimé. En cette période de rentrée scolaire et académique, Ama compte dégager un maximum de profit en faisant un prêt à la FECECAV. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des fournitures scolaires comme : des cahiers, des bics, des crayons, des gommes, des livres,des ensembles géométriques etc.… pour revendre. Avec ces bénéfices, Ama compte envoyer ses enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
A. Ama Adissou, aged 32, is a married mother of three children. She lives in Lomé, a city located about 120 km from Kpalimé. During the current return-to-school season, Ama plans on earning a major profit by obtaining a FECECAV loan. This loan will be used to buy school supplies, such as notebooks, ink pens, pencils, erasers, books, geometry kits, etc…. for resale. With the profits, Ama intends to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Yaritza Yurie

texts.es: La joven Yaritza García de 26 años de edad, es una mujer con deseo de superación, es por eso que con su liquidación de su trabajo anterior en donde laboraba como obrera, logro poner una pulpería el cual lleva siete años administrando, al comienzo fue difícil ya que tenia pocos clientes, pero poco a poco se fue integrando, es casada y tiene dos hijos , su esposo es albañil y cuando no tiene trabajo ayuda en la venta, sus planes con este crédito es poder invertir en granos básicos, carne, golosinas, gaseosas y otros de los cuales son el sustento diario de las familias Nicaragüenses. Es su doceavo crédito y se siente contenta por el apoyo que la institución ha dado ya que cada día invierte en productos nuevos lo que hace captar clientes nuevos. Su objetivo es poder a futuro convertirla en una distribuidora.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, carnes, golosinas

loans.name: Arcangel De Gabriel Group

texts.en:
The group consists of 12 members in Cusco.  The group is called Arcángel Gabriel.  The members are natives of Cusco and surrounding areas.

Some of the members are married, some have children and others are single.

The members work in various positions. - for example, profesor, abogado and student.  One is a salesperson of pots for use in the the kitchen while others sell other items.

With this loan, one will invest in buying wholesale items and others will buy products to augment their businesses. 

All of the members are grateful for the loans and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(One of our members had to leave the meeting before the group photo was taken, so the photo is aggregated with his photo.  One member, Fredy is not pictured in the photo)

loans.use: Invest in materials and wholesale products

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S. was already a retired teacher when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon. She is 64 years old and is retired from her teaching profession but is still very active. She is married to Angelo S., Jr. and they currently operate their own business producing feed out of cassava mixed with some ingredients.  They also make cassava chips, cassava granules and even cassava powder. The couple have 4 children, 2 are already married and 2 are still single and they have 3 grandchildren. They live in Marietta Village, Brgy. Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. 

Her immediate dream is to be able to buy a new machine that will enable them to produce cassava chips and other cassava-based food products more easily.
	
In business one must be a step ahead in terms of strategies and technology. To stay ahead, Letty and her husband needed additional capital, which is the reason why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001. With the infusion of new capital, they were able to survive stiff competition and Letty also supplemented their family income by selling appliances on commission basis as a sideline. With the help of the loans, they were able to expand their operations and even expanded their product distribution to other areas, getting regular customers as far as the province of Iloilo.

Previously, she borrowed Php 29,000 to use as additional capital for her business and as usual the loan was fully paid in full and on time. This contributed to her maintaining her good credit performance. Now for her 18th cycle loan she intends to borrow the same amount of Php 29,000 for her business of producing feeds and cassava-based products. 

The accompanying picture shows Letecia and her husband in their business site with some of their cassava inventory packed in sacks. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase brand new machinery for production & Business expansion

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia INES pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujeres.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ines belongs to the community bank "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Forward"). She is a native of Cusco. Ines is a 43 year-old married mother of four. She has two sons and two daughters. She alternates between household activities and working in her small business selling fruits. She sells regular and wholesale in the "Virgen Asunta" market in Cusco. Ines is asking for a loan to increase the capital of her fruit business. Ines is grateful for the opportunity allowed through this medium. She promises to complete repayments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Jamileth H., Ángela G. y Karla L. conforman al grupo Esperezan. Ellas eligieron este nombre porque aseguran que la esperanza es lo último que se pierde y ellas tienen muchos deseos, sueños y metas por cumplir.
La señora Jamileth H. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de fresco, helado, choco bananos y cosméticos especialmente perfumes.  Mientras Ángela G. tiene una abarrotería en el mercado Oriental  y Karla Antonia L. vende gaseosas, jugos naturales, chiverías, cigarros y recargas claro y movistar    
Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios poder ver lo crecer y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jamileth H., Ángela G., and Karla L. make up the group “Esperanza” (Hope). They chose this name because hope is the last thing to die since they have many desires, dreams, and goals to accomplish.

Sra. Jamileth H. has a small business selling soft drinks, ice cream, chocolate-covered bananas, and cosmetics, especially perfumes. Meanwhile, Ángela G. has a grocery store at the Eastern Market. Karla Antonia L. sells sodas, natural juices, yogurts, cigarettes, and rechargeable phone cards with the Claro and Movistar cellular providers.

They are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses so that they can increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa A. is from the village of Cugman, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Leonisa makes and sells food, mainly snacks and delicacies in the local community.  Leonisa has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leonisa joined HSPFI to access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand his business. 
---------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale.

location.town: Cugman, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 42 años, ella tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decidió sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de ropa usada, debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar, por lo que salía a recorrer las calles ofreciendo la ropa, lamentablemente algunas veces no lograba vender mucho, pero no se dio por vencida y además de salir a vender por las calles también ofrecía sus productos a sus vecinos. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa de cama, ropa para niños, para damas por lo que le permitirán diversificar mas las ofertas de sus productos y así generar un poco de ingresos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña. Maria tiene el deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 42 and has three children. They all work in an independent manner. She sells used clothes. She has been doing this humble work for over three years. She has had many difficulties. She decided to get her children and her family ahead. She decided to buy used clothes because she did not have enough income to support her household. That is why she left to travel the streets offering her clothes. Unfortunately, sometimes she was not able to sell much. But, she did not give up. Besides leaving to sell on the streets, she also offered her products to her neighbors. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital to buy bed linens, children’s clothes, and women’s clothes. This will allow her to diversify more the products that she sells. That way she will generate a little more income because Christmas season is approaching. Maria wishes to establish a clothing store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. RY K. is 34 years old and she is a village bank president of a loan group which consists of 24 people located in Thma Sa village, in Takeo province.  Mrs. RY K. is a farmer who owns piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a breeds pigs. 

In order to improve her family living, Mrs. RY K. decided to apply for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr Snar Panh is a house builder who makes a small income which supports his family. Mrs. RY K. is a mother of two children who are attending in local school. The members of the loan group are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. is married and has four children. She has no formal education. Ama sells okra, garden eggs (eggplant), and other foods in Elmina. She has been running this business for some time now. Her husband is a cleaner. Ama uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save for building a house.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more food, such as okra, to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 34 años, vive junto a su esposo Basilio de 36 años y sus 5 hijos: Alber de 16, Karen de 13, Hellín de 10, Evelin de 6 y Jack de 3 años. Esta numerosa familia vive en su casa propia en la selva central peruana.

Desde hace 7 años cultiva plátanos, café y maíz con la ayuda de operarios, ya que son pocas las veces que su esposo la puede ayudar, pues él ocupa un cargo dentro de su comunidad que le quita mucho tiempo, principalmente en las mañanas, ya que tiene que debe gestionar obras como carreteras, puentes, agua y desagüe para su zona. Adela orgullosa menciona: “mi pareja es bastante conocido y siempre obtiene algo bueno para mi localidad, además es muy responsable como padre y esposo porque nunca nos hace faltar nada”. 
Por otro lado, con los ahorros que tenía compró más terrenos de cultivo para sembrar más productos (frutas) nativos de la selva.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, pues así viene progresando, contando también con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará plantas de café y plátanos, además adquirirá abono para asegurar sus chacras de fréjol, mango, piña y el resto de productos que cultiva.
texts.en:
Adela is a 34-year-old woman. She lives with her husband Basilio (36 years old) and their 5 children: Alber (16), Karen (13), Hellín (10), Evelin (6) and Jack (3). This large family lives in their own house in Peru's central jungle. For 7 years Adela has grown bananas, coffee and corn with hired help, since her husband cannot often help her. He holds a community position which takes a lot of his time, especially in the mornings, as he has to manage public works like highways, bridges, water and drainage for their area. Adela says proudly, "My husband is well-known and always gets something that is good for my town. He is also a very responsible father and husband because he never makes us do without anything that we need." She used her savings to buy more farmland so she could grow more food (fruits) that are native to the jungle. This is the fourth loan she has had with MFP, and she is very grateful to the people who make it possible for her to get a loan. She can have a better life because of them and also because of the support of her communal bank. With the money she is asking for now, she will buy coffee plants and banana plants. She will also get fertilizer for her beans, mangoes, pineapple and the other products she grows.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and banana plants

loans.name: Gbemileke

texts.en: Gbemileke sells motor spare parts at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is a hard working man. He is 36 years old and married with 2 children. His children attend school and this gives him joy. He lives in Oyo state, Nigeria, and says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor parts to sell.

loans.name: Barcero

texts.en:
Barcero E. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan. He is 45 years old, married and has 3 children.  Barcero owns and operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Barcero is just starting this business.

In 2010, Barcero joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Barcero has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Barcero is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Barcero from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°17 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Pour les Femmes Commerçantes N°17, Madame Fatou Kiné D. est la présidente. Cette femme âgée de 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants a préféré cessé très tôt ses études pour se lancer dans le commerce. Elle vend actuellement des chaussures, tissus, sacs, seaux et s’approvisionne jusqu’en Gambie. Elle partage ce sous groupe avec la trésorière Madame Ndèye Coumba S. vendeuse de légumes au marché central de Thiès, Madame Khady L. et Madame Ndèye Ngoné D.  qui vendent toutes les deux de la glace et crème à la gare routière ainsi que Madame Fagui D.  qui fait la couture.
texts.en:
As its name suggests, Femmes Commerçantes is a network of businesswomen. It is based at Grand Thiès and was created in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, its current president. She got the idea of forming the network after participating in a training session run by Oxfam at Thiès, in which she became familiar with group organization and running a business. The members of the group are dedicated to what they do, and meet together once a month. Over and above membership dues, each of them pays 200 FCFA a month into a group solidarity fund. Looking for financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. The network is divided into 19 subgroups of five people so that financing can be better handled. Each subgroup has its own president and treasurer. They now seek, for the second time, a loan of 100,000 FCFA per member or 500,000 FCFA for each subgroup, to grow their various activities. The members repay their loans to the president and the treasurer, Ms. Coumba Seck. They, in turn, are responsible for repaying U-IMCEC. According to the president, the group’s praiseworthy objective is to fight family poverty. Mrs. Fatou Kiné D. is the president of "Femmes Commerçantes N° 17". She is 43 years old and the mother of four children. She chose to interrupt her studies early on to embark upon commercial ventures. Currently she retails shoes, clothing fabric, handbags, buckets, and gets her supplies as far away as Gambia. She shares this sub-group with its treasurer Mrs. Ndèye Coumba S., who retails vegetables at the central market in Thies, Mrs. Khady L. and Mrs. Ndèye Ngoné D. who both sell ice cream at the bus station, and Mrs. Fagui D. who is a seamstress.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply merchandise

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Nagujja Harriet runs a nine-year-old retail business in Kayunga. With it, this diligently hard working, widowed, 50-year-old mother of three kids has managed to elevate her family’s welfare. Ever since she began, she has been making profits of 220,000 shillings a month.

Harriet’s dream is to expand her business to a wholesale franchise, specifically a supermarket. The first step to her achieving this, she says, is to obtain this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more retail stock like sugar, flakes, salt, boxes of milk and cereals

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 52 years old and widowed. She has been selling chickens for 10 years. She is also involved in a construction business.  She is in the Mafuno self-help group in Faulu Kenya where she saves her money on a weekly basis. During the meetings, she also shares business ideas with fellow businessmen and women. Being in this group, she has been guaranteed a loan of 60,000 KES by the group members. With this loan, she plans to buy more chicks and chickens. She hopes that someday she will sell her chicks wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chickens

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta Gómez tiene 56 años de edad, viven en caserío Hatos, cantón La Joya del municipio de Meanguera departamento De Morazán, es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos y un nieto a su cargo, de la edades de 24,20, 16 y 4 respectivamente.
Se dedica a la confección de hamacas hace mas de 8 años, durante el mes ella y sus  hijos elaboran las Hamacas y cuando tiene una cantidad considerable las comercializan trasladándose a San Francisco Gotera donde hay más posibilidades de ventas. 
Anacleta no tiene el dinero suficiente para la compra de materiales y seguir elaborando Hamacas por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de adquirir el préstamo, ella compraría hilo de seda, hilo nailon de diferentes colores,  y de esta forma su familia continuar con la confección de productos ya que el negocio es el principal sostenimiento de necesidades de la familia.
El Dinero le ayudara para incrementar la elaboración de hamacas y apoyar a sus hijos dando una fuente de trabajo ya que actualmente están desempleados, Anacleta está segura que esto contribuirá a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y suplir las necesidades de alimentación y educación; su aspiración es que además de elaborar hamacas diversificar sus productos y confeccionar bolsos, carteras y otros para comercializarlos y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Anacleta Gómez, 56, lives in Hatos settlement, La Joya canton, Meanguera municipality, Morazán department. She’s a single mother of four children and also cares for a grandson; they are 24, 20, 16 and 4 years of age respectively. For over 8 years she has made hammocks. She and her children work for a month making hammocks and when they have a considerable amount completed they go to San Francisco Gotera, where sales opportunities are better, to sell them. Anacleta does not have enough money to buy the necessary materials and supplies to contine making hammocks so she is faced with the need to request a loan. She will buy assorted silk and nylon thread so that her family can continue to make the hammocks since this is the main source of support for the family. The money will help her increase hammock production and support her children providing them with employment because they are currently unemployed. Anacleta is sure that this will improve her family’s quality of life and provide for basic needs like food and schooling. Her aspiration, besides making hammocks, is to diversify her production by adding purses, wallets and other items to her production thereby increasing sales and having more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted silk and nylon thread.

location.town: Caserio Hatos Uno, Canton La Joya, Meanguera, Mora

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Mercedes M. A., es una joven soltera de 23 años de edad que habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, ella es decoradora aun no forma familia, pues planifica tener una mejor estabilidad socioeconómica para ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a los suyos.

Ella vienen de una familia muy humilde, ahora que ella goza de sus propios ingresos y  solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan  construir un muro en la que cierre una división de su cuarto y pueda gozar de su propia independencia, esto le traerá la satisfacción personal de disfrutar de su espacio y el respeto de toda su familia, espera le apoyen en la evolución se sus metas personales y profesionales para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y apoyar a su familia que tanto necesita de su resguardo.
texts.en:
Gloria Mercedes M. A., 23, is a young single woman who lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. She is a decorator and still hasn’t formed a family of her own because she wants to have better economic stability to offer better living conditions to her loved ones. She comes from a very humble family. Now that she earns her own income, she’d like a loan to buy building materials and supplies in order to build a wall to close off her bedroom so that she can have her own privacy. This will provide her with independence and personal satisfaction while enjoying her personal space and the respect of all her family. She hopes she will be supported in her personal and professional goals in order to improve her living conditions and help her family that so much needs her protection.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen D. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock rice and pulses (lentils) to sell.  Hellen is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop for her goods.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock rice and pulses to sell

loans.name: Sonia Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia Águila es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte, esta parroquia es reconocida por su iglesia, siendo su mayora atractivo su gastronomía en donde se presenta una gran variedad de platos típicos como son el chancho horneado, cuy asado y muchos mas platos.

Nuestra socia es costurera, estudio en una academia y ahora tiene su taller 6 años, labora desde su casa y bajo pedido, cose prendas para mujeres y niños, como trabaja en su casa no tiene un horario fijo.

La Señora. Sonia tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo se encuentra en el colegio, su esposo es carpintero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y fue gracias a su cuñada que ingreso a este hermoso grupo de mujeres luchadoras,  su nuevo crédito va a invertir en telas para su negocio, su meta es aprender mucho más de este arte.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia Águila is a member of a communal bank called Estrellitas ("Little Stars"). She lives in the parish of Ricaurte. The parish is known for its church but even better known for its culinary expertise, with a great number of local specialties such as oven-roasted pork and barbecued guinea-pig. Sonia is a seamstress. She studied her trade in a vocational college and has had her own workshop for the past 6 years now. She works from home, sewing women's and children's clothes. Working from home means she doesn't have fixed hours. Sonia is 33 years old, and married with 2 children aged 13 and 3. Her elder son is in high school and her husband is a carpenter. They don't have their own house, but are renting. This is her second loan and it was thanks to her sister-in-law that Sonia became part of this lovely group of determined women. The new loan will be invested in fabric for her business. Her goal is to learn and become more skilled at her trade.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada, vive con el esposo y tiene tres hijos Luis, Alejandro y Daniela, ella se dedica a venta D. productos lácteos.
 El negocio está ubicado en la casa D. habitación, venD. D. queso, crema, quesillo;  los clientes son en mayoría los vecinos y personas que circulan por la zona, actualmente  ella solicita  un préstamo para compra D. materiales D. reparación D. techo y canal D. drenaje D. agua lluvia, ya que por las fuertes lluvias se inunda D. agua la casa. Esto contribuirá a mejorar las condiciones D. la casa y evitar riegos mayores.
Las aspiraciones son cuidar la salud D. los hijos, apoyarlos con los estudios para realicen una carrera universitaria, mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 34 years old. She is married, lives with her husband, and has three children; Luis, Alejandro, and Daniela. She sells milk products from her home, including cheese, cream, and milk curd. Most of her customers are her neighbors and other people who pass through the zone. She is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials so that she can repair her roof and rain water drainage system, because the heavy rains cause her house to flood. This will improve their living conditions and reduce risk. She wants to care for her children’s health, and support them in their schooling, so that they can attend university. She also wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita D. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Bernadita is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Bernadita owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport, "habal-habal", services. Bernadita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bernadita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bernadita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Antonio R. G., tiene la edad de 46 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, y sus 3 hijos adolecentes, ellos se dedican a los estudios, el señor labora como albañil, contando con una experiencia de más de 20 años.

Habitan en un barrio muy peligroso, y su hogar es muy humilde, sus tres hijos y su mujer viven expuestos a la delincuencia que mora cerca de ellos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción con el objetivo de levantar un muro en la parte trasera del hogar y brindarle a su familia una mayor seguridad, y la tranquilidad de padre de familia de velar por los suyos.
texts.en:
Cesar Antonio R. Guzman is 46 and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with his life partner and 3 teenage children. The children study and he is a mason with more than 20 years experience. They live in a very dangerous neighborhood in a a humble home, and his three children and wife are subject to the crime nearby. For that reason he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a rear wall and so provide more security for the family and more peace of mind for the father that looks after them.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min C., 35, is married and lives with her five children in the Takeo province. She works as a farmer, making approximately $0.50 each day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. Her family is also supported by her husband’s $2 in income each day. Min C. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg T. is 44 years old and lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her two children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling tent, in a rented yard. Her daughter attends university while her son attends primary school. Narantsetseg has been operating a business producing dumplings since June 2009 and has built a stable business. She makes her dumplings from intestines and sells her products by visiting shops and stores. Her earnings are the only source of her family's income and provide for her household's needs. In the future, she is planning to make dumplings with meat. She is a very honest and modest woman and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a meat grinder in order to produce meat dumplings.

loans.use: To purchase a meat grinder

loans.name: Mohamad Hassan

texts.en:
Mohamad Hassan is a 20-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and single child. He has worked painting houses since 2007, and he's good at what he does. 

This is the second time Mohamad Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, and this time it's for buying a Rapid, a useful car for his business, that will help him in transporting all his tools in a short time, which will make his business more successful. 

His clients are from his village and from nearby villages. At the beginning Mohamad Hassan faced financial problems that changed with Al Majmoua's help, and he's sure that this loan will bring him a lot of the success he's seeking.

loans.use: To buy a car useful for his business

loans.name: Sonia Vilma

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudió hasta 2do de educación secundaria.

Sonia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, el primer solicitado fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de artesanía.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar materiales para su negocio de venta de artesanía.
	
Su sueño es abrir una empresa de artesanía.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Corazón de Jesús” Communal Bank, which is located in the Juliaca district of San Román province, in the Puno region of Peru. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She completed 2 years of secondary school.
Sonia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year. She first received a 500 PEN loan, which she used to increase working capital for her artisan business.
She is requesting a new 1000 PEN loan to buy materials for her business.
Her dream is to open a company selling artisan goods.
Her favourite things about her communal bank are the meetings and the conversation.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her artisan business

loans.name: Karina Adely

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos decorativos para fiestas infantiles (piñatería) en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio, adicionalmente brinda servicio de decoración para fiestas infantiles y diversos acontecimientos sociales. El negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que ella es una de las pocas personas que brinda este servicio y además es bastante rentable ya que ella misma elabora sus productos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de los gastos económicos de su familia.

Ella desea adquirir material como telas y tubos de metal para ampliar su negocio ya que usualmente tiene que alquilarlos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo. Karina es una joven bastante creativa y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacerse mas conocida en el rubro.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old.  She is single and lives together with her parents and siblings in Tambogrande district, a farming area which is in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Karina sells decorative articles for children's birthday parties (piñatas) in a small establishment located in her home.  She also provides decoration services for children's birthday parties and various social events.  Her business is very popular in the area since she is one of few people who provide this service and it is quite profitable because she makes her products herself.  She uses the income from this activity to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with her family's expenses.

Karina would like to acquire materials such as fabric and metal tubes to expand her business since she usually has to hire them.  For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles which she will use to achieve her goal.  Karina is quite a creative and enterprising young woman.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to become better known in her field.

loans.use: To buy fabric and metal poles to expand her business making decorations for parties and social events

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora L. is from the village of Capellan. She is 48 years old. Teodora is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Teodora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of different products and fruits in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teodora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Teodora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isidora Del Milagro

texts.es:
Isidora es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Saltur del distrito de Zaña, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a la crianza y venta de cerdos en un ambiente ubicado cerca a su domicilio, ella los alimenta de pastos naturales y alimento balanceado, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona con una periodicidad determinada. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Isidora desea mejorar su negocio alimentando de mejor modo a sus animales, de modo que se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir comprando alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Isidora is a housewife who is 40 years old. She lives with her family in the Saltur neighborhood in the district of Zaña, an agricultural area that is located a half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. 

For over five years she has been raising and selling pigs in a location near her home. She feeds then natural pasture and a balanced feed. When they reach a good level of development she sells them to her neighbors and merchants that visit the area on a regular basis. She uses the income from this business to help her family get ahead.

Isidora wants to improve her business by feeding her animals in a better way so that they will develop better and can be sold at a better price. This is why she has thought it convenient to request a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles (PEN) which she will invest in purchasing a balanced feed.

loans.use: Purchase a balanced feed to obtain improvements in her business of raising and selling pigs.

loans.name: Marleny Liliana

texts.en: Marleny belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 28 years old. She and her common-law husband have three children. Marleny is a street vendor in Baratillo: a few blocks in Cusco where street vendors gather to sell their wares.  She sells energy-saving light bulbs and will use the loan to invest in her business, buying more light bulbs to sell. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Buy light bulbs to sell

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline I. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 49 years old. Marline is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marline owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marline has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marline is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Marline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
43-year-old Estrella is a rice farmer from the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has 4 kids, aged 15, 13, 10 and 8. All her four kids go to school. Estrella's husband is also a farmer and sidelines as a carpenter. They both work hard to provide their children's needs and sustain their education.

Estrella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farming necessities, such as seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is divorced and has 7 dependents. She cooks waakye for sale at Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast.  Waakye is rice cooked with beans, usually accompanied by fish, macaroni, wele (cow skin), salad and pepper or a tomato-based sauce. 

Beatrice has been in this business for the past eight years. Her income provides food and money for school fees for her dependents. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase additional food items to cook to generate more sales. Her goal is to eventually build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying school fees.

loans.name: 0203014 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Dung N. T. (203087) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Dung is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
