Rossana now feels that she is a very accomplished woman who wants to achieve and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful for the help that the Manuela Ramos organization gave her in starting her business, along with the many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing banana trees

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Rosa es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
Los sueños de Rosa son ampliar su local, aumentar su negocio e hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paloma Community Bank. Rosa is 60 and has five children. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells general groceries like vegetables, fruits, and drinks. She works every day with some help from her children. Rosa needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy rice, sugar and drinks. Rosa’s dreams are to expand her store, increase her business, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Carmelina es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Hacen pequeñas fiestas entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras, hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúnen cada 2 semanas.
La señora María  tiene 45 años, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales viven con ella todavía. Todos sus hijos ya son grandes y trabajan, menos el menor que está estudiando todavía. La señora trabaja como empleada en varias casas de su comunidad, limpiando y haciendo los quehaceres domésticos.  
Lamentablemente, la Sra. Maria Carmelina tiene algunos problemas de salud, tuvo un derrame cerebral hace un tiempo y todavía está sintiendo los efectos. Sigue trabajando siempre y cuando pueda para poder sustentarse económicamente, porque su esposo no le ayuda mucho en la parte económica. Está pidiendo un préstamo de 440 para poder invertir en los materiales que necesita para poder realizar su trabajo como empleada doméstica. 
Su meta para el futuro es mejorar de salud y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Carmelina is a member of the communal bank "Mujer y Fortaleza" (Woman and Strength), a group of women who live in the community of Turi, about half an hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. They are a group of women who get along very well with each other; they spend their meetings laughing and telling jokes. They throw small parties together for occasions like Mother's Day, and they are good collaborators. They even take turns sweeping after every meeting, at the house where they meet every two weeks.

María is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children, 3 of whom still live with her. All her children are grown up and work, except for the youngest who is still studying. She works as an employee in several homes in her community, cleaning and doing domestic chores.

Unfortunately, María Carmelina has had some health problems. She had a stroke a while ago, and is still feeling its effects. She continues to work as much as she can to be able to economically sustain herself, because her husband does not financially help her much.

She is requesting a loan of $440 to invest in the materials she needs to do her job as a domestic employee. Her goal for the future is to improve her health and have economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to work as a domestic employee

loans.name: Mery Celina

texts.es:
La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc.

Su deseo es poder llenar su tienda para que haya más movimiento de clientes, por lo que obtendría mas ganancias para  ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta de Manuela la puntualidad y la organización.
texts.en:
Sra. Mery is a member of the Communal Bank “30 de Agosto”, which is located in the Illave District of El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She was able to pursue a higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Sra. Mery operates a grocery store. Her first loan of 500 soles was used as operating capital to acquire groceries.

She is requesting another loan in the amount of 1500 soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, etc. She hopes to fill her store to encourage more customer traffic, which will result in more earnings for her to support her children. Sra. Mery likes the punctuality and organization displayed by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is married and has two children. She lives in Githurai, which is a highly populated, very busy center with many businesses. She has been in the decoration sales and beauty cosmetics business for the last 9 years and her customers include middle and low income earners.

Judy has not borrowed from other sources, and this is her first loan with KADET. She wants to add more stock for her decorations and beauty shop, but she also wants to diversify and start other businesses. She intends to open an electronics shop and also sell some clothes.

She believes that diversifying with other businesses will increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products, electronics, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz A. is from the village of San Jose in Camiguin. She is 57 years old. Luz is single. To make a living, Luz owns and  operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Eulalia Modesta

texts.es: Eulalia Modesta M. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos y ninguno y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy responsable, y disfruta de su trabajo ya que comparte con muchas personas. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballero, ropa para damas, cosméticos. Su mayor sueño es mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio de vida que ella tiene.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Jose Roberto G. C. de 37 años de reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad,Jose vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos Edwin de 14 años, Samuel de 10 años y Sarita de 5 años de edad. Jose es un padre de familia muy responsable, actualmente el se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de ciudad arce, tiene una clientela ya estable por que cuenta con seis años de experiencia en el negocio, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio surtiendo de nuevos productos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Arian Group

texts.en:
This is Arian group. The group is made up of three members and Shaima is the group leader. These three members have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

Shaima is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. She embroiders in her house. Now, with the Kiva loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine and wants to start her business in its new way to support her husband and children.

Nazia, who is the second member of Arian group, has a tailoring business. Through its income she supports her family members and her purpose of getting loan is to expand her business.

The last member is Taj Baroo who is a quilt maker.

They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jenny Giovanna

texts.es:
La socia JENNY pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JENNY, 26, is a member of the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank; she is single and from the city of Cusco. She alternates her domestic chores with her work tending a small, wholesale and retail, fruit sales stand in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs the funds to increase her working capital in her fruit sales business. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in fruit sales business

loans.name: Yevgen

texts.en:
Yevgen is single. He is an entrepreneur from Khoost where he sells sports and tourism equipment in one of the local malls called “Senator”. His vending location is known for good quality, durable equipment.

As tourism is quite popular in this part of the country, known for its mountains and picturesque nature, Yevgen’s merchandise is always in high demand. He has been in the trade for two years. Presently, he has 3,500 Grivnyas of monthly net profit.

Yevgen is seeking a 6,500 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital. He is hoping to become a successful businessman one day. We believe his optimism, hard work, and good potential will help him achieve his goals and succeed in his endeavors.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech E., 26, lives in SiE. Reap Province, where she earns her daily income by selling a few vegetables in the local market. She also plants a variety of crops on the land next to her house, where her husband farms with her. They have been married for a year but have no children. In the past, Pech E. has needed to pay fees to taxis to deliver her vegetables to the market for sale, and she now hopes to use a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle which she will use for her transportation needs. She will use the remainder of the loan to build her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ausner Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ausner Pérez desde hace cinco años se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa comercializada ambulantemente en las calles del departamento de Masaya siendo este negocio el que le permite obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia a la que tanto ama.

A diario ofrece la ropa a sus clientes y hay días los cuales vende todo pero también hay días que no logra vender mucho y actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa, sabanas y blusas para abastecerse de ello y así continuar ofreciendo dicha ropa en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Ausner Pérez has been selling clothing for five years as a street vendor in Masaya; this is the business that enables him to obtain the income to support his family that he loves so much. Daily he offers clothing to his customer and there are days where he sells everything but also there are days were he isn’t able to sell much. Today he is seeking a loan to invest in buying clothing, sheets, and blouses to support himself and offer those items in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Jossie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish to members of the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jossie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jossie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SALOME INGRESO A TRABAJAR CON PRESTAMOS EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION DESDE EL 4 DE FEBRERO DE 2004, TRABAJANDO CON CREDITOS CASI 6 AÑOS. SIENDO LA CLIENTE EXCLUSIVA DE EMPRENDER, QUIEN VIVE EN LA ZONA DE VILLA VICTORIA DE NUESTRA CIUDAD. TIENE COMO NEGOCIO VENTA DE CARNE, UBICADA SU CARNICERIA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, ELLA ATIENDE EL NEGOCIO DESDE LAS 7:00 A.M. HASTA 12:00 a.M. YA TIENE UNA ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO DE 15 AÑOS Y MOSTRO MUCHO CRECIMIENTO EN MAQUINARIA. ELLA ESTA MUY FELIZ DE TRABAJAR CON LA INSTITUCION E INGRESAR A NUESTRO PROGRAMA KIVA YA QUE TAMBIEN LE AYUDA A COLABORAR CON LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS 3 HIJOS MENORES QUE SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO Y UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES DE PODER VER A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES Y TAMBIEN COMPRARSE UNA CASITA.

ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salome began working with loans from our institution on the 4th of February, 2004. She has worked with loans for the past 6 years. She is the exclusive client of "Emprender" (To Start) and lives in the Villa Victoria zone of our city. She sells meat from a butcher’s shop located within her own home. She works in her business from 7:00am to 12:00am. She has owned the business for 15 years and has shown much growth in machinery. She is very happy to work with the institution and has joined our Kiva program which also helps her contribute to the schooling of her 3 young children. One of her wishes is to be able to see her children become professionals and also to buy herself a little house. She is very grateful to "Emprender" and Kiva for the trust they bring to the awarding of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Mrs. Rekha S. is a grocery store keeper in the Town of Sanepa. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks etc. She uses her income in fulfilling household needs.

Now she is requesting a 20,000 NPR loan to buy grocery goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Mbande Group

texts.en:
Agness Mathew, age 35, is married and has four children ages 13, 11, 8, and 6.  She has been selling rice and wheat flour at wholesale prices, for two years now.  She opens her shop from 7 am to 6 pm daily and has been able to make a monthly profit of  around  US$ 150.

This will be Agnes’s 1st 'motisha' loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her inventory of rice and wheat flour.
	
Agness will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture,  Agness is  3rd from left.

loans.use: To buy more rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Alma Boniao Group

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Alma is the group leader of a 3-member group loan (17000 PHP) offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy runs a small business that sells clothing. He started this business eight years ago.

Evgeniy used to work as an electrician for a coal mine but the job had high risk and low salary. So he decided to quit and became self-employed. Today he has two business locations that sell clothing, shoes, and bags. His main competitive advantage is a big variety and affordable prices.

Evgeniy would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase spring jackets. He hopes to increase his sales and earn additional income.

Evgeniy has a thirteen-year-old daughter who lives with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase spring jackets

loans.name: Chorro Para Arriba Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chorro para Arriba está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ello es la señora Alejandra Cristiana García quien desde hace cuatro años se  dedica a la realización de bolis y gelatinas. Este producto lo realiza y distribuye a distintos puntos de Masaya  junto con sus tres hijos. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de componentes que ocupan día a día para la producción estos son gelatina, acido, saborizante y azúcar.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Miriam del Socorro R. de 52 años quien vende café, pan y golosinas en la zona Franca, Juana Z. quien es tortillera desde hace 17 años y Sonia G. Bario vende comida, refrescos, gaseosas y helados.
texts.en:
The group “Chorro para Arriba” (Stream Upward) consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Alejandra Cristiana García who has been making popsicles and gelatins for four years. She and her three children distribute her products to different areas in Masaya. Alejandra will use her loan to buy all the necessary components she uses every day to make her products such as gelatin, acid, flavoring, and sugar.

Her fellow group members are Miriam del Socorro R. (age 52) who sells coffee, bread, and candy in the free trade zone; Juana Z. who has been making tortillas for 17 years; and Sonia G. Bario who sells food, refreshments, sodas, and ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making popsicles & gelatins

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Massa O. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children who range from one to eleven years of age. Massa could not continue her education through high school.
For the last ten years, Massa has been selling cooked food at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started selling with funds given to her by her husband, but she lacks assistance in her business operation. Massa provides good service to her customers in order to keep them returning. She plans to use her 12,000 LRD portion of this 37,000 LRD group loan to purchase more ingredients and utensils for cooking. Her goal and dream is to advance and increase her business size to a shop.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Massa is holding the sign. Joe is inset lower right.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and utensils for cooking

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia G. I. de 50 años de edad, vive junto a dos hijos, de los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar y el menor de 13 años de edad a estudiar, junto a ellos reside en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Lucia se dedica a trabajar cuidando ganado, y así mismo para poder obtener ganancias extras, elabora tamales de elote, tortas, atol y elotes asados, estos los elabora cada tarde, los cuales comercializa a las afueras de su hogar, todo con el deseo de poder contar con una estabilidad económica aceptable junto a sus hijos. Lucia ha sido una persona quien siempre ha luchado mucho por su hogar y por sus hijos, es por esto que ella desea poder mejorar y salir adelante, mejorando la estabilidad de su negocio y de esta manera el de su casa, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar elotes por mayor y de esta forma elaborar más platillos los cuales son elaborados a base de estos, ya que todos los antojitos hechos de elote poseen una gran demanda en este país, por lo que se venden muy bien. Es por esta razón que ella desea aumentar su producción y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia G. I. is 50 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with her two sons. Her older son works, and the younger one, who is 13 years old, goes to school. Lucia works caring for livestock, and in order to earn extra money, she makes corn tamales, cakes, atol (a hot corn drink), and fried corn. She makes these every afternoon and sells them outside of her house in order to have economic stability for her sons. Lucia is a person who has always fought a lot for her home and her sons, and this is why she wants to improve and prosper by improving the stability of her business. She is asking for a loan in order to have the necessary money to buy corn wholesale, so that she can make more dishes that are made of corn. Foods made from corn are in great demand in this country, so they sell very well. It is for this reason that she would like to increase her production and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of corn to make traditional foods

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
la sra. Digna A. se dedica la venta de ropa nueva, como ser camisas, camisetas, ropa interior etc,  no tiene dependientes sus hijos todos estan casados.
su esposo Juan Mejia se dedica a la agricultura.
Digna tiene el negocio desde hace varios años, nos comento que con este negocio a podido darles estudio a sus hijos que hoy son profesionales.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de ropa por que en el pueblo hay una actividad 
en donde la gente viene a comprar de otras partes de Langue y necesita tener variedad para poder cumplir las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Digna A. sells new clothing like shirts, t-shirts, underwear, etc. She does not have any dependents, as her children are all married. Her husband, Juan Mejia, works in agriculture. Digna has run her business for several years. She notes that this business allowed her to send her children to school, so today they are professionals. She will use this loan to purchase clothing, because there is an event in her town where people come from other parts of Langue to shop. Digna needs to have a variety of merchandise to meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, dresses, underwear, t-shirts, shorts, socks

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: B. Cécile est née en 1951 et vit depuis une trentaine d’année au quartier Sèdégbé dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi au Bénin. Cécile est une veuve et mère d’un enfant qui est à sa charge. Cécile vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les charges de la famille. Cécile a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis près de trente cinq ans, Cécile mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (savons, riz, œufs, conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, papier hygiénique, bougies, piles, eau de javel, etc.) et aussi des condiments à son domicile. Cécile achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Cécile sollicite un appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle. Cécile a bien remboursé le premier prêt qu’elle avait obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Cécile B. was born in 1951, and for the last thirty years or so she has lived in the Sèdégbé area in the commune of Abomey Calavi, in Benin. Cécile is a widow, and the mother of one child in her care. She lives alone with her child and takes on the family expenses by herself. Cécile left school at the secondary level. For almost thirty five years she has been working at selling various products (soap, rice, eggs, canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, bathroom tissue, candles, batteries, bleach, etc.) as well as condiments, at her house. Cécile buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. This is the second time that Cécile has asked for financial support from ALIDé, with the goal of increasing the level of her activity even more, and to gain more customers. Cécile has fully repaid the first loan that she obtained from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes and various products (rice, eggs, canned foods, milk, candles, etc.)

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 1 años y aprendió a administrar mejor su negocio y a ahorrar.
Esther vive en la casa de sus suegros y su mayor sueño es construir su casa, Esther es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, Esther comienza su día de trabajo a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, negocio que inicio hace 5 años. Esther solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones de niños.
El esposo se Esther estudia en la Universidad y su mayor sueño es que termine sus estudios, además de construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
For the past year, Esther has pertained to the Communal Bank, Despertar, and has learnt to manage her business better and to save money. She lives in the home of her in-laws and her greatest dream is to construct a home of her own. Esther has got two small children and rents a stall at the 12 de abril market, where she sells various types of clothing. Esther begins her day at 8am in the morning and works until 6pm in the afternoon in her business which she began 5 years ago. She is applying for a loan of 3000 soles which she plans on investing in the purchase of polo shirts and children's pants. Esther's husband studies at the University and his greatest dream is to finish his studies, in addition to constructing a house and educating his children.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts and children's pants.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita M. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Renita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Renita owns & operates a furniture making business, making & selling bamboo beddings & other miscellaneous furniture to local businesses and community members. Renita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Renita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Renita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Renita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a 53-year-old widow with three adult children. To make a living, Lilia plants and harvests bananas for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Doris Gilda

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de kantuta” desde hace cuatro años atrás, ubicado en la Provincia de Yunguyo y Departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con grado de instrucción superior completo, tiene tres  hijos, uno de 20 y dos de 18  años de edad (gemelos).
Gilda tiene su propio restaurant de comida desde hace ocho años. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y ampliar su negocio.
Ahora solicitará  un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles  para comprar  vívereres.   
Su visión es tener un hotel. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Doris has been member for four years of the community bank “Flor de kantuta” (kantuta flower), it's located in the Province of Yunguyo, department of Puno, she is 50, married, finished high school and has three children ages 20 and eighteen (twins). Doris has had her own restaurant for eight years. With the first loan (500 new soles) requested to the Manuela Ramos movement she was able to increase working capital and expand her business. She now requests a loan of 1,000 new soles to buy groceries. She envisions having a hotel. What she likes the most about the community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and groceries to prepare food

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 49 years old and married. She has eight children and the younger ones still go to school. To make a living, Manuela operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Manuela has been engaged in her business for over 29 years.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Manuela is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Estela Maribel

texts.es: Estela Maribel R. D. P., madre soltera D. dos hijos D. 10 y 12 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una tortillería la cual está ubicada en el mercado D. la colonia El Matazano ubicado en el mismo municipio D. Soyapango. Ella cuenta con 6 años D. contar con este negocio el cual le permite brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales son la prioridad en su vida. Con el deseo D. poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus pequeños, Estela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una nueva cocina para hacer las tortillas, así mismo comprar cilindros D. gas propano y también comprar maíz y frijol por mayor. Estela desea salir adelante y D. esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Estela Maribel R. D. P. is a single mother of two children who are 10 and 12 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. Estela has a tortilla stand in the El Matazano market which is located in the municipality of Soyapango. She has been in this business for six years and it allows her to proviD. everything necessary to her two small children who are her priority.

With the desire to be able to proviD. her children with a better life, Estela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a new cooker to make the tortillas, as well as propane gas tanks and wholesale corn and beans. Estela wants to get ahead and this way, have a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase corn and beans.

loans.name: Nelly Margoth

texts.es:
Nelly Margoth C. C. tiene 21 años. Es soltera vive con un hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 
 
Nelly pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Nelly trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la comprar maiz arroz y frejol. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero para dar la educación al hijo.
Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Nelly Margoth C. C. is 21 years of age.  She is single and lives with her son in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She has one son. 
 
Nelly belongs to the Nueva Inspiración (New Inspiration) communal bank located in the Anchoveta precinct, which belongs to the Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It is a group dedicated to farming crops with short growing cycles, mainly corn, rice and grandul beans (similar to black-eyed peas).  This group has 13 members.

Nelly works in agriculture.  She sows corn, rice and beans.  She buys her seed in Guayaquil and sells her crops in the in the area near her home and in the market of Ventanas. 

She requests the loan to buy corn and rice for sowing.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  Her dream is to buy supplies to continue sowing her crops and to have money to give an education to her son.  She likes to cook.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice and beans for sowing crops.

loans.name: Sonia Roxana

texts.es:
La Sra A. D. Q. Sonia Roxana cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su domicilio desD. el mes D. marzo del 2009 hasta la actualidad. Asímismo se dedica también a la venta D. cerveza y D. comida en las quincenas D. cada mes. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería y D. un exhibidor para mostrar los productos que ofrece en su negocio.
Tiene buenas referencias personales por parte D. los vecinos y tiene deseos D. superación para asi obtener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sonia Roxana A. D. Q. has had a small store in her home from March 2009 to the present. She also works selling beer and food every two weeks.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise and a showcase to show the products that she sells in her business.

She has good personal references from her neighbors, as well as professional references, and has the desire to succeed so that she has a better quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: La Señora Maria Isaura tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, vive en el municipio de santo tomas, en donde tiene una gran variedad de clientes. Tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad ambos estudian en colegios públicos. Con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos educación, casa, salud y vestimenta. Ella es comerciante de ropa la ofrece de manera ambulante todos los días sin un horario fijo, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años. Este crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir más su local. Ya que actualmente tiene ciertos pedidos por acercarse la época navideña y así ofrecer variedad.
texts.en: Maria Isaura has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time.  She lives in the town of Santo Tomas where she has a lot of customers.  She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children who are both studying in local schools.  Through work and effort, she and her husband have managed to provide their children with education, a house, healthcare and clothes.  Maria Isaura has a business selling clothes.  She sells her goods itinerantly every day without fixed hours.  She has been doing this for 4 years.  She will invest this loan in buying more clothes to stock her business since she currently has some orders pending with the Christmas period approaching and she would like to be able to offer more variety.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ma. Amparo

texts.en:
Ma. Amparo M. is from the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 39 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Amparo owns and operates a vulcanizing shop. The main source of income for the business comes from providing services in the local community. Ma. Amparo has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Amparo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Amparo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. Ma. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ma. Amparo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Doria

texts.en:
Doria B. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 29 years old. Doria is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Doria owns & operates transportation business. Doria has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Doria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Doria is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better transportation services. This will be the first loan taken out by Doria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 59 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, es viuda,  vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos de los 9 que tiene. Siendo sola,  tuvo que trabajar duro y parejo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ocupándose así en  diversas actividades. De entre todas, lo que más le gustaba desarrollar, fue el servicio de lavado de ropa a domicilio. De esa amanera solo acumulaba algunas ganancias, con ello fue educando a sus hijos. Pero a medida que pasó el tiempo, quiso ganar más, así que se propuso comprar su lavadora y se compró uno de segundo uso, desde entonces su labor es más productiva y rentable. En adelante, quiere terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar  un lugar para desarrollando dicha actividad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará accesorios para mandar a reparar su lavadora.
texts.en: Ana is a very happy and hardworking 59-year-old mother.  She is widowed and lives in her own house with three of her nine children.  Being single, she had to work hard and consistently to get her children ahead, which is why she kept herself busy with various activities.  Of all of them, what she has liked most was the home clothes washing service.  She only earned some money through this, which she used for her children’s education.  As time passed, however, she wanted to earn more so she decided to purchase a used washing machine.  Since then, her work has been more productive and profitable.  In the future, she wants to finish building her house and set up a place to do her work.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is sure that this loan will be very beneficial to her business’ development.  With the loan requested, she will buy accessories to fix her washing machine.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and spare parts to fix her washing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase all the necessities of her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 42 years old, is from the town of San Francisco. She is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 15 years old, while the youngest is only 3. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna works hard to sustain her children's education. She says that as their mother, it's her responsibility to give them proper education.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zyndel Marie

texts.en:
Zyndel Marie is a 21-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Puerto Princesa City,  Palawan. 

Zyndel Marie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Zyndel Marie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks for the store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements of her business.

 Zyndel Marie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Jenis

texts.es:
Jenis O. Ramírez, tiene 33 años y vive en Barranquilla, ciudad donde comercializa mercancía variada, como bolsos, calzados, vestidos y productos de belleza; desde hace 18 años se inició en la actividad mercantil,  que fue su primera experiencia,  en el sector de alimentos,  vendía carnes frías  y con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y disciplina, logro reunir gradualmente sus capital de trabajo, incluyendo en su oferta una gran variedad   de productos que  incrementaron sus utilidades, impactando positivamente  los ingresos de su hogar. 
Su meta principal es el crecimiento de su negocio, para seguir apoyando a su esposo en las obligaciones familiares que comparten, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la educación de sus dos  hijos. Su mayor desafío se presento cuando bajaron las ventas por la ola invernal que se presentó a finales del año pasado,  pero el negocio de Jenis  gradualmente se ha ido recuperando y ha vuelto a la normalidad.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y justamente su primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará vestuario y calzado, porque con esta venta ensanchará la cobertura de clientes, entre los que se encuentra   referidos  a los que quiere llegar y de los cuales tomó sus pedidos, esto  garantizaría la inversión exitosa de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jenis O. Ramírez is 33 years old and lives in Barranquilla where she sells various items such as purses, shoes, dresses, and beauty products. She has been a merchant for 18 years, beginning in the food sector. She sold fried meats and with much effort, dedication, and discipline, gradually increased her working capital, and added a variety of products. This greatly increased her income for her household.

Her main goal is to enlarge her business, to continue helping her husband with their shared family obligations, especially their children's education. Her greatest challenge came when sales decreased with the cold weather at the end of last year. But the business has gradually recuperated and is now back to normal. 

This is Jenis’ first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva. She will use the money to buy clothing and footwear. With this purchase, she will widen her client base, from past customers to referred customers and future customers. This would guarantee a successful investment of the loan.

loans.use: Buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Nora Abrenilla's Group

texts.en:
Nora A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan,Isabela. She is 38 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa E. is married to a cleaner and they have six children. For the past 20 years, she has run two businesses to help support their family. She is a baker and also sells charcoal in the village of Ntranoa, near Elmina town. Her earnings help pay for the school fees. 

Adjowa wishes to grow her business and will use her loan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She plans to reinvest the additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, a 35-year-old married mother of five children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 10 years and earns additional income from vegetable farming and chicken-raising.

Mercy, who has received and repaid 19 loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, biscuits, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Rous' Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. Rous was born in 1964 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Doeuk who was born in 1963, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow vegetables. This is how they support their family. In order to improve the farming, Mrs. Rous would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crop.

This couple has four children: one is a police officer, two are seamstresses in the garment factories, and the last one is student.

loans.use: For supporting her farming crop.

loans.name: Rwengwe Tukore Group

texts.en:
Victor B. is a 43-year-old business man who subsists on his agriculture business. He mostly grows and sells tea leaves in Rwengwe-Kihihi. He has been in this business for the last nine years and he says he joined this business on sensing the ready tea market in most of Western Uganda.

His farming gardens are mostly full of growing tea. Hard work and determination have been the towers of strength for this happily married father of six. He says weekly his tea sales business profits are to the tune of 100,000 UGX. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase fertilizers for his tea gardens.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his tea crop.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients which earns her reasonably good profits. She learned about this art from her mother before her marriage. 

She is also a very good housewife and meets her household responsibilities very well. She is 29 years old and has a little child. She takes care of him well, bringing him up with good care and discipline. 

Her husband is 31 years old and is a carpet weaver. His products are in demand in the market and he earns a good amount of income from his business. 

Humaira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy thread and weaving tools for weaving carpets which will help him make a better income. 

She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his profits and allow her family to live a better life financially. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy thread and weaving tools for carpet weaving

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a single parent taking care of a child. She has received a senior high education. Kate sells fruits, plastic cups, trays and bowls at Elmina, which she has done for 3 years. She wants to increase the sale of plastic containers, so she needs a loan to buy more plastic cups, trays and bowls to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to save towards her child’s education and to reinvest back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more plastic cups, trays and bowls to sell

loans.name: Alianza Unida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Alianza Unida esta formado por 12 mujeres, quienes son muy amables, trabajadoras y luchadoras, cada una de nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades  que les permiten ayudar y mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias es la Señora. Wilma, ella vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana.
 
Tiene 39 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 18 y 13 años de edad, sus dos hijos son casados e independientes y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial y labora en su propio taller, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
 
Doña Wilma labora como empleada privada, se encuentra en este trabajo hace 11 años y labora de lunes a viernes.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos detalles.

Las tres fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de tres socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes en la reunión que se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza Unida" is comprised of 12 women who are kind, hard workers who struggle to get ahead.  Each one of our members works in a different activity which helps support and improve their household economy.  They live in different places around the city of Cuenca which is the third largest in the county.  Its architecture is a blend of colonial and modern and its people maintain the culture and traditions.

One of the members is Mrs. Wilma who lives in the center of Cuenca.  This is her first loan through the communal bank, which her sister invited her to join.  She is 39, married and has three children, ages 19, 18 and 13.  Two of her children are married and independent and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic and works in his own shop.  Together they have been able to build their own house.

Doña Wilma has been a private sector employee for 11 years and works Monday through Friday. She plans to use the loan to buy consumer goods for the household.  Her goal is to finish her home because some things are still missing.

The small photos are of the three members who could not be present for the group picture due to work obligations.

loans.use: To buy consumer goods.

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru:
Amil 29 let. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Amil yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Amil uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov . Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda , v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren Kive i lenderam.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76291
texts.en:
Amil is 29 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Amil is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and child.  Amil has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for eight years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.  This is his second loan.  The first time he borrowed $1200, and he is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the loan.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76291

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Celinda Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora. Celinda es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de Nabon,  esta comunidad  es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

Doña Celinda tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 3 hijos de 9 y 2 años y un bebé de  9 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Celinda se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas. También se dedica a la cría de animales los que vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas.

Su sueño es estudiar en el colegio.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the communal bank "Neuvo Bankito La Ramada" and she lives by the community of Nabon. This community is of cold climate and its people work in agriculture and livestock farming. Much of the population works in the city. 

Celinda is 29 years old, a single mother, and she has conceived 3 children. They are 9, 2, and the baby is 9 months old. Her eldest son attends school in the city. The house in which she lives is her own property. 

Celinda is an agriculturist and she plants vegetables. She also raises livestock and she sells them in her community. 

She is on her fourth loan through her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds. 

Her dream is to go to high school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.
